1.content: = = = = = = Appendix II: The Religion of Dune Before the coming of Muad'Dib, the Fremen of Arrakis practiced a religion whose roots in the Maometh Saari are there for any scholar to see. Many have traced the extensive borrowings from other religions. The most common example is the Hymn to Water, a direct copy from the Orange Catholic Liturgical Manual, calling for rain clouds which Arrakis had never seen. But there are more profound points of accord between the Kitab al-Ibar of the Fremen and the teachings of Bible, Ilm, and Fiqh. Any comparison of the religious beliefs dominant in the Imperium up to the time of Muad'Dib must start with the major forces which shaped those beliefs: 1. The followers of the Fourteen Sages, whose Book was the Orange Catholic Bible, and whose views are expressed in the Commentaries and other literature produced by the Commission of Ecumenical Translators. (C.E.T.); 2. The Bene Gesserit, who privately denied they were a religious order, but who operated behind an almost impenetrable screen of ritual mysticism, and whose training, whose symbolism, organization, and internal teaching methods were almost wholly religious; 3. The agnostic ruling class (including the Guild) for whom religion was a kind of puppet show to amuse the populace and keep it docile, and who believed essentially that all phenomena -- even religious phenomena -- could be reduced to mechanical explanations; 4. The so-called Ancient Teachings -- including those preserved by the Zensunni Wanderers from the first, second, and third Islamic movements; the Navachristianity of Chusuk, the Buddislamic Variants of the types dominant at Lankiveil and Sikun, the Blend Books of the Mahayana Lankavatara, the Zen Hekiganshu of III Delta Pavonis, the Tawrah and Talmudic Zabur surviving on Salusa Secundus, the pervasive Obeah Ritual, the Muadh Quran with its pure Ilm and Fiqh preserved among the pundi rice farmers of Caladan, the Hindu outcroppings found all through the universe in little pockets of insulated pyons, and finally, the Butlerian Jihad. There is a fifth force which shaped religious belief, but its effect is so universal and profound that it deserves to stand alone. This is, of course, space travel -- and in any discussion of religion, it deserves to be written thus: SPACE TRAVEL! Mankind's movement through deep space placed a unique stamp on religion during the one hundred and ten centuries that preceded the Butlerian Jihad. To begin with, early space travel, although widespread, was largely unregulated, slow, and uncertain, and, before the Guild monopoly, was accomplished by a hodgepodge of methods. The first space experiences, poorly communicated and subject to extreme distortion, were a wild inducement to mystical speculation. Immediately, space gave a different flavor and sense to ideas of Creation.

3.content: = = = = = = Appendix III: Report on Bene Gesserit Motives and Purposes Here follows an excerpt from the Summa prepared by her own agents at the request of the Lady Jessica immediately after the Arrakis Affair. The candor of this report amplifies its value far beyond the ordinary. Because the Bene Gesserit operated for centuries behind the blind of a semimystic school while carrying on their selective breeding program among humans, we tend to award them with more status than they appear to deserve. Analysis of their "trial of fact" on the Arrakis Affair betrays the school's profound ignorance of its own role. It may be argued that the Bene Gesserit could examine only such facts as were available to them and had no direct access to the person of the Prophet Muad'Dib. But the school had surmounted greater obstacles and its error here goes deeper. The Bene Gesserit program had as its target the breeding of a person they labeled "Kwisatz Haderach," a term signifying "one who can be many places at once." In simpler terms, what they sought was a human with mental powers permitting him to understand and use higher order dimensions. They were breeding for a super-Mentat, a human computer with some of the prescient abilities found in Guild navigators. Now, attend these facts carefully: Muad'Dib, born Paul Atreides, was the son of the Duke Leto, a man whose bloodline had been watched carefully for more than a thousand years. The Prophet's mother, Lady Jessica, was a natural daughter of the Baron Vladimir Harkonnen and carried gene-markers whose supreme importance to the breeding program was known for almost two thousand years. She was a Bene Gesserit bred and trained, and should have been a willing tool of the project. The Lady Jessica was ordered to produce an Atreides daughter. The plan was to inbreed this daughter with Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen, a nephew of the Baron Vladimir, with the high probability of a Kwisatz Haderach from that union.
3.title: Bene Gesserit motives and purposes
3.abstract: (i) an organism, wherein the organism is at least one of a plant or an animal; and(ii) genetic material comprising a Bene Gesserit gene. The Bene Gesserit gene encodes a polypeptide that inhibits telomere elongation by RNA interference (RNAi). In some embodiments, the Bene Gesserit gene can be operably linked to a transcriptional regulatory sequence native to the organism such that expression of the Bene Gesserit gene results in inhibition of telomere elongation within the organism. Also provided herein are cells, tissues, organs, multicellular organisms, pharmaceutical compositions, and methods related to the Bene Gesserit gene.

8.content: Beside the painting lay a black bull's head mounted on a polished board. The head was a dark island in a sea of wadded paper. Its plaque lay flat on the floor, and the bull's shiny muzzle pointed at the ceiling as though the beast were ready to bellow a challenge into this echoing room. Jessica wondered what compulsion had brought her to uncover those two things first -- the head and the painting. She knew there was something symbolic in the action.

9.content: = = = = = = Prophecy and prescience--How can they be put to the test in the face of the unanswered questions? Consider: How much is actual prediction of the "waveform" (as Muad'Dib referred to his vision-image) and how much is the prophet shaping the future to fit the prophecy? What of the harmonics inherent in the act of prophecy? Does the prophet see the future or does he see a line of weakness, a fault or cleavage that he may shatter with words or decisions as a diamond-cutter shatters his gem with a blow of a knife? -"Private Reflections on Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan "Get their water," the man calling out of the night had said.

9.abstract: A system includes at least one processor configured to perform operations. The operations include receiving an input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the input is associated with a question that does not have a known answer. The operations further include generating a plurality of possible answers corresponding to the question, wherein each of the plurality of possible answers corresponds to a respective likelihood of being correct. The operations further include determining which of the plurality of possible answers most closely resembles the input received from the user via the GUI. The operations further include providing feedback to the user indicating whether or not the determined answer matches the input received from the user via the GUI. A non-transitory computer-readable storage medium stores instructions executable by at least one processor to perform the above-described operations. Various other aspects are described in detail in the present disclosure.

11.content: She trembled so hard the knife blade sent glittering shards of reflection shooting around the room. Jessica waited, poised. She had intended to say the knife was a maker of death and then add the ancient word, but every sense warned her now, all the deep training of alertness that exposed meaning in the most casual muscle twitch. The key word was . . . maker. Maker? Maker. Still, Mapes held the knife as though ready to use it. Jessica said: "Did you think that I, knowing the mysteries of the Great Mother, would not know the Maker?" Mapes lowered the knife.

She glanced back down the hall, again up at the door. Oval? she wondered. What an odd shape for a door in a house. Through the windows beneath the spiral stair she could see the great white sun of Arrakis moving on toward evening. Long shadows stabbed down the hall.

15.content: 5. When the Arrakis Affair boiled up, the Spacing Guild made overtures to the Bene Gesserit. The Guild hinted that its navigators, who use the spice drug of Arrakis to produce the limited prescience necessary for guiding spaceships through the void, were "bothered about the future" or saw "problems on the horizon." This could only mean they saw a nexus, a meeting place of countless delicate decisions, beyond which the path was hidden from the prescient eye. This was a clear indication that some agency was interfering with higher order dimensions! (A few of the Bene Gesserit had long been aware that the Guild could not interfere directly with the vital spice source because Guild navigators already were dealing in their own inept way with higher order dimensions, at least to the point where they recognized that the slightest misstep they made on Arrakis could be catastrophic.

17.abstract: A method is disclosed for retrieving a drowning fisherman from the bottom of a body of water using an unmanned surface vehicle (USV). 20.title: Systems and methods for harvesting moisture from the atmosphere
20.abstract: Implementations of systems and methods for harvesting moisture from the atmosphere are disclosed. In one implementation, a system includes an evaporator configured to receive ambient air having a temperature below a dew point temperature (Td), wherein the evaporator is configured to separate water vapor from non-water vapor in the ambient air to produce first humidified air with a relative humidity greater than or equal to 100%. The system may further include a condenser configured to receive the first humidified air at a pressure less than atmospheric pressure, wherein the condenser is configured to condense water vapor from the first humidified air to produce second humidified air; and a compressor configured to receive the second humidified air at a pressure greater than atmospheric pressure, wherein the compressor is configured to compress the second humidified air to produce pressurized humidified air.

Nefud's eyes opened wide with understanding. "The absence of a thing," the Baron said, "this can be as deadly as the presence. The absence of air, eh? The absence of water? The absence of anything else we're addicted to." The Baron nodded. "You understand me, Nefud?"

25.content: Jessica awakened in cave darkness, sensing the stir of Fremen around her, smelling the acrid stillsuit odor. Her inner timesense told her it would soon be night outside, but the cave remained in blackness, shielded from the desert by the plastic hoods that trapped their body moisture within this space. She realized that she had permitted herself the utterly relaxing sleep of great fatigue, and this suggested something of her own unconscious assessment on personal security within Stilgar's troop. She turned in the hammock that had been fashioned of her robe, slipped her feet to the rock floor and into her desert boots. I must remember to fasten the boots slip-fashion to help my stillsuit's pumping action, she thought. There are so many things to remember. She could still taste their morning meal--the morsel of bird flesh and grain bound within a leaf with spice honey--and it came to her that the use of time was turned around here: night was the day of activity and day was the time of rest. Night conceals; night is safest. She unhooked her robe from its hammock pegs in a rock alcove, fumbled with the fabric in the dark until she found the top, slipped into it. How to get a message out to the Bene Gesserit? she wondered.

On the distant dune, a Fremen waved a square of green cloth: once . . . twice. "More come!" the Fremen beside Hawat barked. "Be ready. I'd hoped to have us away without more inconvenience." Inconvenience! Hawat thought. He saw two more 'thopters swooping from high in the west onto an area of sand suddenly devoid of visible Fremen.

29.content: Paul shifted his crysknife to his left hand, matching his opponent. Again, they circled, probing. Feyd-Rautha began closing the space between them, edging in, knife held high, anger showing itself in squint of eye and set of jaw. He feinted right and under, and they were pressed against each other, knife hands gripped, straining. Paul, cautious of Feyd-Rautha's right hip where he suspected a poison flip-dart, forced the turn to the right.

31.content: And lest she forget that she's servant of us all, to her fall the menial tasks in this Ceremony of the Seed. Let it be as Shai-hulud will have it." She lifted a brown-stick arm, dropped it. Jessica, feeling the ceremony close around her with a current that swept her beyond all turning back, glanced once at Paul's question filled face, then prepared herself for the ordeal. "Let the watermasters come forward," Chani said with only the slightest quaver of uncertainty in her girl-child voice. Now, Jessica felt herself at the focus of danger, knowing its presence in the watchfulness of the throng, in the silence. A band of men made its way through a serpentine path opened in the crowd, moving up from the back in pairs. Each pair carried a small skin sack, perhaps twice the size of a human head.
31.title: Ceremony of the seed

32.content: What matter that whistling sands are an omen? What matter that you must make the sign of the fist when first you see First Moon? A man's flesh is his own and his water belongs to the tribe -- and the mystery of life isn't a problem to solve but a reality to experience. Omens help you remember this.
32.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for providing omens
32.abstract: A method of determining an omen is provided. The method includes receiving data from one or more sensors associated with at least one physical environment; processing the received data to generate sensor data; analyzing the sensor data to determine whether there is any abnormality in the monitored physical environment; if it is determined that there is no abnormality in the monitored physical environment, comparing the sensor data against stored reference data corresponding to normal operation of the plurality of devices within the monitored physical environment so as to identify similarities between the sensor data and the stored reference data; and identifying an omen based on the identified similarities between the sensor data and the stored reference data. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

33.content: Then came the Butlerian Jihad -- two generations of chaos. The god of machine-logic was overthrown among the masses and a new concept was raised: "Man may not be replaced." Those two generations of violence were a thalamic pause for all humankind. Men looked at their gods and their rituals and saw that both were filled with that most terrible of all equations: fear over ambition. Hesitantly, the leaders of religions whose followers had spilled the blood of billions began meeting to exchange views. It was a move encouraged by the Spacing Guild, which was beginning to build its monopoly over all interstellar travel, and by the Bene Gesserit who were banding the sorceresses. Out of those first ecumenical meetings came two major developments: 1. The realization that all religions had at least one common commandment: "Thou shall not disfigure the soul." 2. The Commission of Ecumenical Translators. C.E.T. convened on a neutral island of Old Earth, spawning ground of the mother religions. They met "in the common belief that there exists a Divine Essence in the universe." Every faith with more than a million followers was represented, and they reached a surprisingly immediate agreement on the statement of their common goal: "We are here to remove a primary weapon from the hands of disputant religions. That weapon -- the claim to possession of the one and only revelation."
33.title: Jihad: A Novel of Frank Herbert's Dune Universe
33.abstract: A novel set in the Dune universe created by Frank Herbert.

34.content: A voice hissed: "He sheds tears!" It was taken up around the ring: "Usul gives moisture to the dead!" He felt fingers touch his damp cheek, heard the awed whispers. Jessica, hearing the voices, felt the depth of the experience, realized what terrible inhibitions there must be against shedding tears. She focused on the words: "He gives moisture to the dead." It was a gift to the shadow world-- tears.

35.content: "It's just one of Gurney Halleck's tone poems for sad times." Behind Paul Jessica began to recite: "I remember salt smoke from a beach fire And shadows under the pines -- Solid, clean . . . fixed -- Seagulls perched at the tip of land, White upon green . . . And a wind comes through the pines To sway the shadows; The seagulls spread their wings, Lift And fill the sky with screeches. And I hear the wind Blowing across our beach, And the surf, And I see that our fire Has scorched the seaweed." "That's the one," Paul said.

39.content: "Here is a work with dignity and meaning," they said. "Here is a way to make humanity aware of itself as a total creation of God." The men of C.E.T. were likened to archeologists of ideas, inspired by God in the grandeur of rediscovery. It was said they had brought to light "the vitality of great ideals overlaid by the deposits of centuries," that they had "sharpened the moral imperatives that come out of a religious conscience." With the O.C. Bible, C.E.T. presented the Liturgical Manual and the Commentaries -- in many respects a more remarkable work, not only because of its brevity (less than half the size of the O.C. Bible), but also because of its candor and blend of self-pity and self-righteousness.

She read the more obvious signs in Mapes' actions and appearance, the petit betrayals. "Miseces prejia," she said in the Chakobsa tongue. "Andral t're pera! Trada cik buscakri miseces perakri --" Mapes took a backward step, appeared poised to flee. "I know many things." Jessica said. "I know that you have borne children, that you have lost loved ones, that you have hidden in fear and that you have done violence and will yet do more violence. I know many things."

The step of attaching the multi-faceted lion's head pommel comprises drilling a plurality of holes through the handle at predetermined angles relative to a longitudinal axis of the handle; inserting a plurality of rods into the plurality of drilled holes such that each rod is oriented perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the handle; welding ends of the plurality of rods together to form one or more sides of the multi-faceted lion's head pommel; and removing excess portions of the plurality of rods protruding from opposing sides of the multi-faceted lion's

46.content: And she saw the thread of the past carried by Sayyadina after Sayyadina--first by word of mouth, hidden in the sand chanteys, then refined through their own Reverend Mothers with the discovery of the poison drug on Rossak . . . and now developed to subtle strengthen Arrakis in the discovery of the Water of Life. Far down the inner corridor, another voice screamed: "Never to forgive! Never to forget!" But Jessica's attention was focused on the revelation of the Water of Life, seeing its source: the liquid exhalation of a dying sandworm, a maker. And as she saw the killing of it in her new memory, she suppressed a gasp. The creature was drowned! "Mother, are you all right?" Paul's voice intruded on her, and Jessica struggled out of the inner awareness to stare up at him, conscious of duty to him, but resenting his presence.
46.title: Sandworms of Dune: A Novel of the Planet Arrakis (Dune Universe)

47.content: This was a good dune Stilgar had chosen, higher than its companions for the viewpoint vantage. Stooping, Paul planted the thumper deep into the windward face where the sand was compacted and would give maximum transmission to the drumming. Then he hesitated, reviewing the lessons, reviewing the life-and-death necessities that faced him. When he threw the latch, the thumper would begin its summons. Across the sand, a giant worm -- a maker -- would hear and come to the drumming. With the whiplike hook-staffs, Paul knew, he could mount the maker's high curving back. For as long as a forward edge of a worm's ring segment was held open by a hook, open to admit abrasive sand into the more sensitive interior, the creature would not retreat beneath the desert.

Various other methods, UGVs, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

48.content: There had been Fremen on Poritrin, she saw, a people grown soft with an easy planet, fair game for Imperial raiders to harvest and plant human colonies on Bela Tegeuse and Salusa Secundus. Oh, the wailing Jessica sensed in that parting. Far down the corridor, an image-voice screamed: "They denied us the Hajj!" Jessica saw the slave cribs on Bela Tegeuse down that inner corridor, saw the weeding out and the selecting that spread men to Rossak and Harmonthep.

49.content: = = = = = = Terminology of the Imperium In studying the Imperium, Arrakis, and the whole culture which produced Muad'Dib, many unfamiliar terms occur. To increase understanding is a laudable goal, hence the definitions and explanations given below. ABA: loose robe worn by Fremen women; usually black. ACH: left turn: a worm-steersman's call. ADAB: the demanding memory that comes upon you of itself. AKARSO: a plant native to Sikun (of 70 Ophiuchi A) characterized by almost oblong leaves. Its green and white stripes indicate the constant multiple, condition of parallel active and dormant chlorophyll regions. ALAM AL-MITHAL: the mystical world of similitudes where all physical limitations are removed. AL-LAT: mankind's original sun; by usage: any planet's primary. AMPOLIROS: the legendary "Flying Dutchman" of space. AMTAL or AMTAL RULE: a common rule on primitive worlds under which something is tested to determine its limits or defects. Commonly: testing to destruction. AQL: the test of reason. Originally, the "Seven Mystic Questions" beginning: "Who is it that thinks?" ARRAKEEN: first settlement on Arrakis; long-time seat of planetary government. ARRAKIS: the planet known as Dune; third planet of Canopus.

50.content: Gurney opened the bubble dome, released his safety straps. The instant the factory stopped, he was out, slamming the bubble closed behind him, scrambling out over the tread guards to swing down to the sand beyond the emergency netting.

51.content: It had been a strange day with these two standing guard over him because he asked it, keeping away the curious, allowing him the time to nurse his thoughts and prescient memories, to plan a way to prevent the jihad. Now, standing beside his mother on the cavern ledge and looking out at the throng, he wondered if any plan could prevent the wild outpouring of fanatic legions. Chani, nearing the ledge, was followed at a distance by four women carrying another woman in a litter.

After years of hit-and-run attacks, the fundamentalists have decided to push their agenda on the unsuspecting infidels of the United States.

54.content: He began reexamining the evidence of the dry wells where trickles of water had appeared and vanished, never to return. Kynes set his newly trained Fremen limnologists to work: their chief clue, leathery scraps of matter sometimes found with the spice-mass after a blow. This had been ascribed to a fictional "sandtrout" in Fremen folk stories. As facts grew into evidence, a creature emerged to explain these leathery scraps -- a sandswimmer that blocked off water into fertile pockets within the porous lower strata below the 280° (absolute) line. This "water-stealer" died by the millions in each spiceblow.

55.content: He leaned back, grabbed the microphone from the panel, punched out a new frequency selection. Glancing at the grid chart on rollers over their heads, he spoke into the microphone: "Calling crawler at Delta Ajax niner. Wormsign warning. Crawler at Delta Ajax niner. Wormsign warning. Acknowledge, please." He waited. The panel speaker emitted static crackles, then a voice: "Who calls Delta Ajax niner?
55.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with a crawler in a wormhole
55.abstract: A method of communicating with a first node that is connected to a second node via a wormhole includes receiving, at the first node, a message from the second node through the wormhole. The method also includes determining whether the received message comprises an acknowledgement (ACK) frame or a negative acknowledgement (NACK) frame. In response to determining that the received message does not comprise an ACK frame or a NACK frame, the method further includes forwarding the received message to one or more destination nodes other than the second node. On the other hand, in response to determining that the received message comprises an ACK frame or a NACK frame, the method further includes transmitting another message to the second node using the wormhole.

56.content: Perhaps it could become a good home for my son. Then he saw the human figures moving into the flower fields, sweeping them with strange scythelike devices--dew gatherers. Water so precious, here that even the dew must be collected.

The method comprises the steps of providing an evaporative cooling system, wherein the evaporative cooling system includes at least one heat exchanger that transfers heat from air flowing through the at least one heat exchanger to water in contact with the at least one heat exchanger; determining whether there is sufficient moisture in the air to be cooled by the evaporative cooling system; if it is determined that there is sufficient moisture in the air to be cooled by the evaporative cooling system, activating the evaporative cooling system so as to transfer heat from the air being cooled to the water in contact with the at least one heat exchanger; and collecting the water in contact with the at least one heat exchanger into a collection container.

58.content: The man squatting across from Hawat was a Fremen who had come across the sink in the first light of false dawn, skittering over the sand, blending into the dunes, his movements barely discernible. The Fremen extended a finger to the sand between them, drew a figure there. It looked like a bowl with an arrow spilling out of it. "There are many Harkonnen patrols," he said. He lifted his finger, pointed upward across the cliffs that Hawat and his men had descended. Hawat nodded. Many patrols. Yes. But still he did not know what this Fremen wanted and this rankled. Mentat training was supposed to give a man the power to see motives.

59.content: Her fingers detected the subtle coded dots, scanned them in a single passage: "Your son and Duke are in immediate danger. A bedroom has been designed to attract your son. The H loaded it with death traps to be discovered, leaving one that may escape detection." Jessica put down the urge to run back to Paul; the full message had to be learned. Her fingers sped over the dots; "I do not know the exact nature of the menace, but it has something to do with a bed. The threat to your Duke involves defection of a trusted companion or lieutenant. The H plan to give you as gift to a minion.

Leto had been wise to choose this place for his seat of government. The name, Arrakeen, had a good sound, filled with tradition. And this was a smaller city, easier to sterilize and defend. Again there came the clatter of boxes being unloaded in the entry.

65.content: "Movement across the landscape is a necessity for animal life," his father said. "Nomad peoples follow the same necessity. Lines of movement adjust to physical needs for water, food, minerals. We must control this movement now, align it for our purposes."

The control unit is configured to receive data from the at least one sensor indicative of the motion of the animal detected by the at least one sensor while the animal wears the housing, analyze the data received from the at least one sensor in accordance with predetermined criteria, and provide feedback to the animal as a result of analyzing the data received from the at least one sensor using the predetermined criteria. Various other implementations may be described and/or claimed.

An apparatus for growing plants in an extraterrestrial environment is also provided.

Paul thought about what the Dune man and Kynes had said. He sensed half-truths, outright lies. The men on the sand had glided across the surface so surely, moving in a way obviously calculated to keep from luring the worm back out of its depths. Fremen! Paul thought.

70.content: It had been an odd sensation putting on the crinkling, slick-surfaced garment. In his foreconsciousness had been the absolute knowledge that he had never before worn a stillsuit. Yet, each motion of adjusting the adhesion tabs under Gurney's inexpert guidance had seemed natural, instinctive. When he had tightened the chest to gain maximum pumping action from the motion of breathing, he had known what he did and why. When he had fitted the neck and forehead tabs tightly, he had known it was to prevent friction blisters. Kynes straightened, stepped back with a puzzled expression.

71.content: "It has been calculated with precision," Stilgar whispered. "We know to within a million decaliters how much we need. When we have it, we shall change the face of Arrakis." A hushed whisper of response lifted from the troop: "Bi-lal kaifa." "We will trap the dunes beneath grass plantings," Stilgar said, his voice growing stronger. "We will tie the water into the soil with trees and undergrowth." "Bi-lal kaifa," intoned the troop.
71.title: The sandworms of Arrakis: genetic engineering, ecology, and ecosystem dynamics of Dune's sandworm Paul Muad'Dib Atreides
71.abstract: This dissertation is an interdisciplinary examination of Frank Herbert's science fiction novel Dune (1965) from the perspectives of evolutionary biology, paleontology, planetary geology, and astrobiology. In particular, it focuses on the desert-dwelling organism known as the sandworm, which plays a pivotal role in shaping the fictional world of Dune. The goal of this dissertation is to provide readers with a better understanding of the natural processes that could give rise to creatures like the sandworm within our own solar system or elsewhere in the universe. By exploring the plausibility of such phenomena, we can deepen our appreciation for the imaginative power of science fiction while also gaining valuable insights into the workings of nature itself.

74.content: -from "The Collected Sayings of Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan Paul-Muad'Dib remembered that there had been a meal heavy with spice essence. He clung to this memory because it was an anchor point and he could tell himself from this vantage that his immediate experience must be a dream. I am a theater of processes, he told himself. I am a prey to the imperfect vision, to the race consciousness and its terrible purpose. Yet, he could not escape the fear that he had somehow overrun himself, lost his position in time, so that past and future and present mingled without distinction. It was a kind of visual fatigue and it came, he knew, from the constant necessity of holding the prescient future as a kind of memory that was in itself a thing intrinsically of the past. Chani prepared the meal for me, he told himself.

75.content: = = = = = = Over the exit of the Arrakeen landing field, crudely carved as though with a poor instrument, there was an inscription that Muad'Dib was to repeat many times. He saw it that first night on Arrakis, having been brought to the ducal command post to participate in his father's first full staff conference. The words of the inscription were a plea to those leaving Arrakis, but they fell with dark import on the eyes of a boy who had just escaped a close brush with death.

The boy's reactions were those of youth and trained to a peak these people had never seen. But the attack was trained, too, and conditioned by the necessities of penetrating a shield barrier. A shield would repel too fast a blow, admit only the slowly deceptive counter. It needed control and trickery to get through a shield.

79.content: "I wish to show you something, weirding woman." He led her around a curve of rock toward the light source. Jessica found herself looking out across the wide lip of another opening to the cave, an opening high in a cliff wall--looking out across another basin about ten or twelve kilometers wide. The basin was shielded by high rock walls. Sparse clumps of plant growth were scattered around it. As she looked at the dawn-gray basin, the sun lifted over the far escarpment illuminating a biscuit-colored landscape of rocks and sand. And she noted how the sun of Arrakis appeared to leap over the horizon.

80.content: There was that consistent increase of moisture at median altitudes, and in certain winds. There was that primary clue in the air balance -- 23 per cent oxygen, 75.4 per cent nitrogen and .023 per cent carbon dioxide -- with the trace gases taking up the rest. There was a rare native root plant that grew above the 2,500 meter level in the northern temperate zone. A tuber two meters long yielded half a liter of water. And there were the terraform desert plants: the tougher ones showed signs of thriving if planted in depressions lined with dew precipitators. Then Kynes saw the salt pan. His 'thopter, flying between stations far out on the bled, was blown off course by a storm. When the storm passed, there was the pan -- a giant oval depression some three hundred kilometers on the long axis -- a glaring white surprise in the open desert. Kynes landed, tasted the pan's storm-cleaned surface.

84.content: There is the place the Reverend Mothers are so reluctant to mention--the place where only a Kwisatz Haderach may look. This realization returned a small measure of confidence, and again she ventured to focus on the psychokinesthetic extension, becoming a mote-self that searched within her for danger. She found it within the drug she had swallowed. The stuff was dancing particles within her, its motions so rapid that even frozen time could not stop them. Dancing particles. She began recognizing familiar structures, atomic linkages: a carbon atom here, helical wavering . . . a glucose molecule. An entire chain of molecules confronted her, and she recognized a protein . . . a methyl-protein configuration. Ah-h-h!

85.content: Presently he said, "It's time to go to the arena." "Indeed," said the Count. They moved out of the cone of silence and, side by side, walked toward the clumps of Houses Minor at the end of the hall. A bell began a slow tolling somewhere in the keep--twenty-minute warning for the arena gathering. "The Houses Minor wait for you to lead them," the Count said, nodding toward the people they approached. Double meaning . . . double meaning, the Baron thought. He looked up at the new talismans flanking the exit to his hall--the mounted bull's head and the oil painting of the Old Duke Atreides, the late Duke Leto's father. They filled the Baron with an odd sense of foreboding, and he wondered what thoughts these talismans had inspired in the Duke Leto as they hung in the halls of Caladan and then on Arrakis--the bravura father and the head of the bull that had killed him. "Mankind has ah only one mm-m-m science," the Count said as they picked up their parade of followers and emerged from the hall into the waiting room--a narrow space with high windows and floor of patterned white and purple tile. "And what science is that?" the Baron asked. "It's the um-m-m-ah-h science of ah-h-h discontent," the Count said. The Houses Minor behind them, sheep-faced and responsive, laughed with just the right tone of appreciation, but the sound carried a note of discord as it collided with the sudden blast of motors that came to them when pages threw open the outer doors, revealing the line of ground cars, their guidon pennants whipping in a breeze. The Baron raised his voice to surmount the sudden noise, said, "I hope you'll not be discontented with the performance of my nephew today, Count Fenring." "I ah-h-h am filled um-m-m only with a hm-m-m sense of anticipation, yes," the Count said. "Always in the ah-h-h process verbal, one um-m-m ah-h-h must consider the ah-h-h office of origin."

86.content: It was said that its pages were filled with a seductive interest in logic. Revisions that catered to popular bigotry began appearing. These revisions leaned on accepted symbolisms (Cross, Crescent, Feather Rattle, the Twelve Saints, the thin Buddha, and the like) and it soon became apparent that the ancient superstitions and beliefs had not been absorbed by the new ecumenism. Halloway's label for C.E.T.'s seven-year effort -- "Galactophasic Determinism" -- was snapped up by eager billions who interpreted the initials G.D. as "God-Damned." C.E.T. Chairman Toure Bomoko, an Ulema of the Zensunnis and one of the fourteen delegates who never recanted ("The Fourteen Sages" of popular history), appeared to admit finally the C.E.T. had erred.

88.content: He glanced down at the hooks in his left hand, thinking that he had only to shift those hooks down the curve of a maker's immense side to make the creature roll and turn, guiding it where he willed. He had seen it done. He had been helped up the side of a worm for a short ride in training. The captive worm could be ridden until it lay exhausted and quiescent upon the desert surface and a new maker must be summoned. Once he was past this test, Paul knew, he was qualified to make the twenty-thumper journey into the southland -- to rest and restore himself -- into the south where the women and the families had been hidden from the pogrom among the new palmaries and sietch warrens. He lifted his head and looked to the south, reminding himself that the maker summoned wild from the erg was an unknown quantity, and the one who summoned it was equally unknown to this test. "You must gauge the approaching maker carefully," Stilgar had explained. "You must stand close enough that you can mount it as it passes, yet not so close that it engulfs you."

91.abstract: request to initiate an interaction between the first user device and a second user device; determining that the first user device is not authorized to interact with the second user device; in response to determining that the first user device is not authorized to interact with the second user device, transmitting, to the first user device, one or more instructions comprising information indicating that the first user device is not authorized to interact with the second user device; receiving, from the first user device, confirmation that the first user device understands that the first user device is not authorized to interact with the second user device; and enabling the interaction between the first user device and the second user device after receiving the confirmation that the first user device understands that the first user device is not authorized to interact with the second user device.

92.content: "This doltish Gurney Halleck has forgotten the first lesson for a fighting man armed and shielded." Paul snapped the force button at his waist, felt the crinkled-skin tingling of the defensive field at his forehead and down his back, heard external sounds take on characteristic shield-filtered flatness. "In shield fighting, one moves fast on defense, slow on attack," Paul said. "Attack has the sole purpose of tricking the opponent into a misstep, setting him up for the attack sinister. The shield turns the fast blow, admits the slow kindjal!" Paul snapped up the rapier, feinted fast and whipped it back for a slow thrust timed to enter a shield's mindless defenses.
92.title: Method and apparatus for simulating swordfighting in a virtual reality environment
92.abstract: A method of simulating swordfighting in a virtual reality environment includes receiving, by a computing device, an input from a user to simulate swordfighting between the user and another user. The method also includes displaying, by the computing device, a first avatar associated with the user and a second avatar associated with the other user. The method further includes detecting, by the computing device, one or more actions performed by at least one of the first avatar or the second avatar. The method additionally includes determining, by the computing device, whether the detected one or more actions indicate that the user has been struck by the other user. In response to determining that the user has been struck by the other user, the method includes notifying, by the computing device, the user that the user has been struck by the other user.

93.content: "Yes." He followed her across the first arrow, seeing it go black as they touched it. Another arrow beckoned ahead. They crossed it, saw it extinguish itself, saw another arrow ahead.
93.title: Arrow-shooting device and method of using the same
93.abstract: An arrow-shooting device includes an elongated shaft having a proximal end and a distal end. A nock is attached to the proximal end of the elongated shaft. An archer's hand grip is attached to the distal end of the elongated shaft, wherein the archer's hand grip comprises at least one finger groove configured to receive at least one digit of a user's hand.

94.content: Scatter on the sand." The troop began working down the worm's sides, dropping off, blending with the sand beneath their cloaks.
94.title: Method and apparatus for concealment of a person or object in a sandy environment
94.abstract: A method is provided for concealing a person or object in a sandy environment. The method comprises the steps of: (a) determining at least one environmental parameter; (b) receiving an input from a user, wherein the input includes information relating to movement of the person or object through the sandy environment; (c) using the determined at least one environmental parameter and the input received from the user as inputs to a machine-learned model configured to generate a set of instructions that can be used to move the person or object through the sandy environment without being detected; and (d) providing the generated set of instructions to the user such that the user can use the set of instructions to move the person or object through the sandy environment without being detected. An apparatus adapted to carry out the method is also provided.

95.content: "Think on it, Chani: that princess will have the name, yet she'll live as less than a concubine -- never to know a moment of tenderness from the man to whom she's bound. While we, Chani, we who carry the name of concubine -- history will call us wives." = = = = = = Appendix I: The Ecology of Dune Beyond a critical point within a finite space, freedom diminishes as numbers increase. This is as true of humans in the finite space of a planetary ecosystem as it is of gas molecules in a sealed flask. The human question is not how many can possibly survive within the system, but what kind of existence is possible for those who do survive. -Pardot Kynes, First Planetologist of Arrakis The effect of Arrakis on the mind of the newcomer usually is that of overpowering barren land.
95.title: Systems and methods for managing dune erosion
95.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for monitoring, detecting, and/or mitigating beach erosion. In some implementations, one or more sensors may be used to determine an amount of sand that has been moved from a first location to a second location over a predetermined period of time. The determined amount of sand may be correlated with wind speed data collected during the predetermined period of time. Based at least in part on the correlation between the determined amount of sand and the wind speed data, it may be determined that there is a likelihood that additional sand will be moved from the first location to the second location within a subsequent predetermined period of time. One or more actions may then be taken to mitigate further movement of sand from the first location to the second location after the subsequent predetermined period of time.

96.content: "The threat's something else. Perhaps it has to do with the lasguns. Perhaps they'll risk secreting a few lasguns with timing mechanisms aimed at house shields. Perhaps they'll . . . " "And who could tell after the blast if the explosion wasn't atomic?" he asked.
96.title: Method and apparatus for detecting explosive devices in luggage
96.abstract: A method of detecting an explosive device in luggage is disclosed. The method comprises scanning the luggage with electromagnetic waves to generate one or more images of the luggage; analyzing the one or more images to identify at least one anomaly within the luggage; determining whether the at least one anomaly corresponds to an explosive device; and, if it is determined that the at least one anomaly corresponds to an explosive device, triggering an alarm. An apparatus for detecting an explosive device in luggage is also disclosed wherein the apparatus comprises means for scanning the luggage with electromagnetic waves to generate one or more images of the luggage; means for analyzing the one or more images to identify at least one anomaly within the luggage; means for determining whether the at least one anomaly corresponds to an explosive device; and, if it is

97.content: "Now," Stilgar said, and his voice was harsh, "show me you know how to handle a maker. Which side are we on?" Paul glanced down at the scaled ring surface on which they stood, noted the character and size of the scales, the way they grew larger off to his right, smaller to his left. Every worm, he knew, moved characteristically with one side up more frequently. As it grew older, the characteristic up-side became an almost constant thing. Bottom scales grew larger, heavier, smoother. Top scales could be told by size alone on a big worm.
97.title: Method and apparatus for determining the age of earthworms
97.abstract: A method is disclosed for determining the age of an earthworm. The method comprises obtaining at least two images of the earthworm from different angles, wherein each image has a plurality of pixels; extracting one or more landmark points in each image by detecting local maxima that are not connected to any other local maxima within a predetermined distance therefrom; measuring distances between pairs of extracted landmark points in successive images so as to determine relative displacement vectors (RDV's); calculating absolute displacement vectors (ADV's) using the RDV's with respect to a baseline image; comparing the ADV's with previously stored information relating to known ages of earthworms having similar morphological characteristics to the earthworm under test; and determining the age of the earthworm according to the results of the comparison. A corresponding apparatus is also

98.content: "The highest function of ecology is understanding consequences." The voice shocked him because he recognized it and knew the owner of it was dead. It was the voice of his father who had been planetologist here before him- -his father long dead, killed in the cave-in at Plaster Basin. "Got yourself into quite a fix here, Son," his father said.
98.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and mitigating risks associated with geologic hazards on an extraterrestrial body
98.abstract: A method of detecting and mitigating risks associated with geologic hazards on an extraterrestrial body is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (a) receiving data from at least one sensor, wherein the received data includes information relating to subsurface conditions; (b) analyzing the received data in order to determine whether or not there is a risk of seismic activity occurring within a predetermined time period; (c) if it is determined that there is a risk of seismic activity occurring within the predetermined time period, transmitting a warning signal via a communications link between the spacecraft and Earth-based ground station(s); and (d) if it is determined that there is no risk of seismic activity occurring within the predetermined time period, preventing transmission of the warning signal via the communications link.

99.content: The thing dropped a half meter, quartered to the left, circled back around the bed. A faint humming could be heard from it. Who is operating that thing?
99.title: Apparatus and method for detecting an intruder in a room
99.abstract: A system comprises one or more sensors configured to generate sensor data indicative of at least one environmental condition within a room. A processor is coupled to the one or more sensors, wherein the processor is configured to receive the sensor data generated by the one or more sensors. The processor is further configured to analyze the sensor data received from the one or more sensors to determine whether there is an intruder in the room. In response to determining that there is an intruder in the room, the processor is configured to initiate an emergency alert procedure.

100.content: "Child, can you communicate with your brother?" "My brother knows I'm here," Alia said.
100.title: Systems and methods for secure communications between children and caregivers
100.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for facilitating child-caregiver communications. In one implementation, a method is provided that includes receiving, by a server from a mobile device associated with a first user, a request to initiate a communication session with a second user; transmitting, by the server in response to receipt of the request, an invitation to participate in the communication session to the mobile device associated with the second user; receiving, by the server from the mobile device associated with the second user, acceptance of the invitation to participate in the communication session; establishing, by the server in response to receipt of the acceptance, the communication session between the mobile device associated with the first user and the mobile device associated with the second user; and managing, by the server during the communication session, transmission of data between the mobile device associated with the first user and the mobile device associated with the second user.

101.content: "Broach one for those that need it," Stilgar said. "Watermaster . . . where is a watermaster? Ah, Shimoom, care for the measuring of what is needed. The necessity and no more. This water is the dower property of the Sayyadina and will be repaid in the sietch at field rates less pack fees." "What is the repayment at field rates?" Jessica asked.
101.title: Method and apparatus for harvesting water from an atmospheric or sub-atmospheric reservoir
101.abstract: A method of harvesting water from an atmospheric or sub-atmospheric reservoir includes the steps of (a) positioning at least one conduit within the reservoir; (b) pumping fluid into the reservoir through the at least one conduit; (c) heating the fluid in the reservoir to produce vapor; (d) removing the vapor from the reservoir via the at least one conduit; and (e) condensing the vapor removed from the reservoir to produce liquid. An apparatus for harvesting water from an atmospheric or sub-atmospheric reservoir is also disclosed.

102.content: Why an airlock in a house? she asked herself. And she thought suddenly of exotic creatures sealed off in special climates. Special climate! That would make sense on Arrakis where even the driest of off-planet growing things had to be irrigated.
102.title: Method and apparatus for controlling humidity in a building
102.abstract: A method of controlling humidity in a building includes measuring an indoor relative humidity (RH) at a plurality of locations within the building. The method also includes determining, based on the measured indoor RHs, whether to activate or deactivate one or more HVAC units associated with the building. In addition, the method includes actuating the one or more HVAC units when it is determined that the one or more HVAC units should be activated.

103.content: "You gave a good answer." Jessica marked the easy rumble of the man's voice. It was a royal voice, accustomed to command.
103.title: Apparatus and method for providing an audio response to a spoken utterance
103.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to apparatuses, methods, computer-readable storage media, and systems for determining one or more characteristics associated with a voice signal received from a user device. In some implementations, such techniques may be performed by processing circuitry executing instructions stored in non-transitory machine-readable media.

104.content: "Mood?" Halleck's voice betrayed his outrage even through the shield's filtering. "What has mood to do with it?
104.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining a user's emotional state
104.abstract: A method of determining a user's emotional state is provided. The method includes receiving an audio input from the user; processing the audio input to identify one or more acoustic features in the audio input; classifying the one or more acoustic features as belonging to at least one of a plurality of predetermined emotional states; and providing feedback to the user indicating that the user is experiencing the at least one of the plurality of predetermined emotional states. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also provided.

105.content: "A lasgun beam touched it and . . . " He shrugged. "Subatomic fusion," Jessica said. "That's a dangerous weapon." "Not weapon, m'Lady, defense. That scum will think twice before using lasguns another time." The Fremen from the ornithopters stopped above them. One called in a low voice: "We should get under cover, friends."
105.title: Method and apparatus for subatomic fusion powered spacecraft propulsion
105.abstract: A method of generating thrust from an atomic fusion reactor is disclosed. The method includes the steps of (a) injecting hydrogen gas into a reaction chamber; (b) heating the hydrogen gas in the reaction chamber to form plasma; (c) accelerating the plasma out of the reaction chamber by means of electromagnetic waves, wherein the electromagnetic waves are generated by at least one electrode positioned within the reaction chamber; and (d) extracting kinetic energy from the accelerated plasma as thrust. An apparatus for generating thrust from an atomic fusion reactor is also disclosed.

106.content: You will be perfectly secure as long as you remain here, and we'll have this little trouble cleared up very shortly." Paul caught the code words in his father's message--guard-safe-secure-shortly. The problem was security, not violence. He saw that his mother had read the same message.
106.title: Method and apparatus for securing access to a guarded area
106.abstract: A method of controlling access to a guarded area is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) determining an identity of a user; (b) obtaining biometric data from the user; (c) comparing the obtained biometric data with stored biometric data associated with the determined identity, wherein the stored biometric data is indicative of one or more previous visits by the user to the guarded area; and (d) in response to a match between the obtained biometric data and the stored biometric data, permitting access to the guarded area by the user. An apparatus for controlling access to a guarded area is also disclosed.

107.content: Five legions--fifty brigades! --attacking the Duke's main base at Arrakeen. A legion at Arsunt. Two battle groups at Splintered Rock. Then the reports became more detailed--there were Imperial Sardaukar among the attackers--possibly two legions of them. And it became clear that the invaders knew precisely which weight of arms to send where. Precisely! Superb Intelligence. Hawat's shocked fury had mounted until it threatened the smooth functioning of his Mentat capabilities. The size of the attack struck his mind like a physical blow. Now, hiding beneath a bit of desert rock, he nodded to himself, pulled his torn and slashed tunic around him as though warding off the cold shadows. The size of the attack. He had always expected their enemy to hire an occasional lighter from the Guild for probing raids.
107.title: Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune
107.abstract: A method of treating cancer in a patient, comprising administering to the patient a therapeutically effective amount of an anti-CD47 antibody or fragment thereof. In some embodiments, the anti-CD47 antibody or fragment thereof binds to human CD47. In some embodiments, the anti-CD47 antibody or fragment thereof binds to both human CD47 and murine CD47. In some embodiments, the anti-CD47 antibody or fragment thereof specifically binds to human CD47 but does not specifically bind to murine CD47. In some embodiments, the anti-CD47 antibody or fragment thereof specifically binds to murine CD47 but does not specifically bind to human CD47.

108.content: Jessica felt the religious ritual in the words, noted her own instinctively awed response. They're in league with the future, she thought. They have their mountain to climb. This is the scientist's dream . . . and these simple people, these peasants, are filled with it. Her thoughts turned to Liet-Kynes, the Emperor's planetary ecologist, the man who had gone native--and she wondered at him. This was a dream to capture men's souls, and she could sense the hand of the ecologist in it.
108.title: A sandworm of Dune (Betrayal of Dune)
108.abstract: The present invention relates to a sandworm of Dune (Betrayal of Dune).

109.content: I should feel something. But he felt nothing except: Here's an important fact. It was one with all the other facts. All the while his mind was adding sense impressions, extrapolating, computing. Halleck's words came back to Paul: "Mood's a thing for cattle or for making love.
109.title: Systems and methods for determining a mood of a user
109.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for determining a mood of a user. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an audio signal from a microphone associated with a user; processing the audio signal to generate a first feature vector; comparing the first feature vector to a plurality of pre-stored second feature vectors corresponding to a plurality of predetermined emotional states; in response to determining that the first feature vector does not correspond to any of the plurality of pre-stored second feature vectors, generating a new second feature vector by modifying at least one component of the first feature vector; adding the new second feature vector to the plurality of pre-stored second feature vectors as a new third feature vector; and associating the new third feature vector with the current emotional state of the user.

110.content: He glanced abound the room, noting that Hawat's men already had been over it, checking, making it safe for a duke's heir. The subtle code signs were all around. Paul watched the rolling, ugly man set himself back in motion, veer toward the training table with the load of weapons, saw the nine-string baliset slung over Gurney's shoulder with the multipick woven through the strings near the head of the fingerboard. Halleck dropped the weapons on the exercise table, lined them up -- the rapiers, the bodkins, the kindjals, the slow-pellet stunners, the shield belts. The inkvine scar along his jawline writhed as he turned, casting a smile across the room.
110.title: Sword and laser: a novel of the fourth horseman of the apocalypse
110.abstract: A method for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a UAV from a ground control station (GCS), at least one command to be performed by the UAV; determining, by the UAV, whether the at least one command complies with predetermined conditions; if the at least one command complies with the predetermined conditions, performing, by the UAV, the at least one command; otherwise, rejecting, by the UAV, the at least one command until the at least one command complies with the predetermined conditions. Various other methods, systems, and/or computer-readable storage media are also disclosed.

111.content: She tensed, then glimpsed a simple clock-set servok with pipe and hose arms. An arm lifted, sent out a fine spray of dampness that misted her cheeks. The arm retracted and she looked at what it had watered: a fern tree. Water everywhere in this room--on a planet where water was the most precious juice of life. Water being wasted so conspicuously that it shocked her to inner stillness.
111.title: Method and apparatus for controlling humidity in an enclosed environment
111.abstract: A method of controlling humidity in an enclosed environment is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (i) measuring at least one environmental parameter within the enclosed environment; (ii) determining, from the measured at least one environmental parameter, whether or not it is desirable to change the relative humidity within the enclosed environment; (iii) if it is determined that it is desirable to change the relative humidity within the enclosed environment, then changing the relative humidity within the enclosed environment according to a predetermined control algorithm; and (iv) periodically repeating steps (i)-(iii). An apparatus for controlling humidity in an enclosed environment is also disclosed.

112.content: Originally a sour milk drink. LISAN AL-GAIB: "The Voice from the Outer World." In Fremen messianic legends, an offworld prophet. Sometimes translated as "Giver of Water." (See Mahdi.) LITERJON: a one-liter container for transporting water on Arrakis; made of high-density, shatterproof plastic with positive seal. LITTLE MAKER: the half-plant-half-animal deep-sand vector of the Arrakis sandworm. The Little Maker's excretions form the pre-spice mass. MAHDI: in the Fremen messianic legend, "The One Who Will Lead Us to Paradise." MAKER: see Shai-hulud. MAKER HOOKS: the hooks used for capturing, mounting, and steering a sandworm of Arrakis. MANTENE: underlying wisdom, supporting argument, first principle. (See Giudichar.) MATING INDEX: the Bene Gesserit master record of its human breeding program aimed at producing the Kwisatz Haderach. MAULA: slave. MAULA PISTOL: spring-loaded gun for firing poison darts; range about forty meters. MELANGE: the "spice of spices," the crop for which Arrakis is the unique source. The spice, chiefly noted for its geriatric qualities, is mildly addictive when taken in small quantities, severely addictive when imbibed in quantities above two grams daily per seventy kilos of body weight. (See Ibad, Water of Life, and Pre-spice Mass.)
112.title: Apparatus and method for spice planet arrakis
112.abstract: A system includes a processor configured to execute instructions stored in memory. The instructions, when executed by the processor, cause the processor to receive an input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the input comprises one or more words associated with Spice Planet Arrakis of Frank Herbert's Dune universe. The instructions, when executed by the processor, further cause the processor to determine whether the one or more words are misspellings of at least one correct word among the one or more words. The instructions, when executed by the processor, further cause the processor to identify that the one or more words are misspellings if it is determined that the one or more words are misspellings. The instructions, when executed by the processor, further cause the processor to replace the one or more words with the at least one correct word.

113.content: "Two liters; one liter; seven watercounters of one drachm each; one watercounter of three-thirty-seconds drachms. In all--thirty-three liters and seven and three-thirty-seconds drachms."
113.title: Apparatus and method for measuring liquids
113.abstract: A liquid measurement apparatus is provided. The apparatus includes a housing having an inlet port, an outlet port, and a chamber between the inlet port and the outlet port. A sensor assembly is disposed within the chamber of the housing. The sensor assembly includes one or more sensors configured to measure at least one property of a liquid flowing through the inlet port and exiting from the outlet port. An actuator assembly is disposed within the chamber of the housing. The actuator assembly includes one or more actuators configured to move the sensor assembly relative to the chamber so as to position the one or more sensors with respect to the liquid flowing through the inlet port and exiting from the outlet port such that the one or more sensors are capable of measuring the at least one property of the liquid while the liquid flows through the inlet port and exits from the outlet port.

114.content: Kynes thought. My Fremen have found me! Then he heard the sand rumbling. Every Fremen knew the sound, could distinguish it immediately from the noises of worms or other desert life. Somewhere beneath him, the pre-spice mass had accumulated enough water and organic matter from the little makers, had reached the critical stage of wild growth. A gigantic bubble of carbon dioxide was forming deep in the sand, heaving upward in an enormous "blow" with a dust whirlpool at its center. It would exchange what had been formed deep in the sand for whatever lay on the surface.
114.title: Sandworms of Arrakis: planetary ecology and evolution of
114.abstract: The sandworms of Dune are described in detail, including their physiology, anatomy, genetics, behavior, reproduction, life cycle, diet, symbiosis with the spice melange, and interactions with humans.

115.content: Maker--their word for worm, she thought. She measured the import of his words, the statement that they could not permit a worm into this basin. She knew what she had seen in the mirage--Fremen riding on the back of a giant worm. It took heavy control not to betray her shock at the implications.
115.title: Sandworms of Dune
115.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for generating sandworms are provided. The method may include receiving an input to generate a sandworm comprising one or more genetic traits associated with the sandworm. The method may further include determining at least one trait from the one or more genetic traits associated with the sandworm that is selected by a user via a graphical user interface (GUI). The method may also include modifying the one or more genetic traits associated with the sandworm in accordance with the determined at least one trait. In addition, the method may include generating the sandworm based on the modified one or more genetic traits associated with the sandworm. Further, the method may include providing the generated sandworm to the user via the GUI.

116.content: Leave the thing in the water." He brought out his hand, shook water from it, staring at the quiescent metal in the fountain.
116.title: Apparatus and method for cleaning a surface of an object submerged in a body of water
116.abstract: A system is provided for cleaning a surface of an object submerged in a body of water. The system includes a vessel configured to receive the object, at least one nozzle positioned within the vessel so as to direct a stream of fluid toward the surface of the object, wherein the at least one nozzle is movable relative to the vessel between a retracted position and an extended position, and a motor coupled to the at least one nozzle such that actuation of the motor causes movement of the at least one nozzle from the retracted position to the extended position.

117.content: The Duke banked into his air cover, the other craft taking up their guard positions as they headed southeast. "The design and manufacture of these stillsuits bespeaks a high degree of sophistication," the Duke said. "Someday I may show you a sietch factory," Kynes said. "I would find that interesting," the Duke said. "I note that suits are manufactured also in some of the garrison cities." "Inferior copies," Kynes said. "Any Dune man who values his skin wears a Fremen suit."

118.content: "Yet we take the time to . . . " He motioned with his head toward the arch now far behind them. " . . . make . . . dew collectors?" "The planting goes on." "What're dew collectors?" he asked.
118.title: Systems and methods for harvesting moisture from atmospheric water vapor
118.abstract: Implementations of systems and methods for harvesting moisture from atmospheric water vapor are disclosed. In one implementation, a system includes an air inlet configured to draw ambient air into the system; a dew point temperature (DPT) sensor configured to measure a DPT of the ambient air; a humidity sensor configured to measure a relative humidity (RH) of the ambient air; a compressor configured to pressurize the ambient air; a condenser coil configured to receive the pressurized ambient air via the air inlet and cool the pressurized ambient air using refrigerant flowing through the condenser coil; a heat exchanger configured to receive the pressurized ambient air that has been cooled by the condenser coil and condense at least a portion of the RH of the pressurized ambient air as liquid water onto surfaces of the heat exchanger; and a

119.content: She had removed her stillsuit and wore a graceful blue wraparound that exposed her thin arms. Near the shoulder on her left arm, a green kerchief had been tied.
119.title: Protective garment for use in a post-apocalyptic setting
119.abstract: A protective garment is provided. The protective garment includes an outer layer and an inner layer disposed between the outer layer and the wearer of the protective garment. A plurality of openings are formed through the outer layer, wherein each of the plurality of openings provides access to at least one of the inner layer or the wearer of the protective garment.

120.content: "Those were Sardaukar in Harkonnen uniform," Jessica whispered. They could hear pounding on the door now, rhythmic blows. Kynes indicated the cabinets against the right-hand wall, said: "This way." He crossed to the first cabinet, opened a drawer, manipulated a handle within it. The entire wall of cabinets swung open to expose the black mouth of a tunnel. "This door also is plasteel," Kynes said.
