120.abstract: 1. A method comprising: determining, by one or more processors of an electronic device, that the electronic device is located within a predetermined geographic area; in response to determining that the electronic device is located within the predetermined geographic area, causing presentation of content associated with Baron Vladimir Harkonnen from Frank Herbert's Dune novels on a display of the electronic device; and receiving, by the one or more processors, input indicative of a selection of at least one portion of the content associated with Baron Vladimir Harkonnen from the Frank Herbert's Dune novels; and in response to receiving the input, causing at least a portion of additional content associated with Baron Vladimir Harkonnen from the Frank Herbert's Dune novels to be presented on the display.

121.content: Some smugglers employed the domesticated desert ass, the kulon, but the water price was high even when the beasts were fitted with modified stillsuits. Kynes thought of installing reduction plants to recover water from the hydrogen and oxygen locked in native rock, but the energy-cost factor was far too high.
121.title: Systems and methods for mitigating desertification of Arrakis (Dune)
121.abstract: Implementations described herein relate to systems and methods for mitigating desertification of Arrakis (Dune). In one implementation, a method includes receiving an input image depicting at least a portion of Arrakis. The method further includes determining that the input image is associated with sandworm spawning or not associated with sandworm spawning. Based on whether the input image is associated with sandworm spawning or not associated with sandworm spawning, the method includes generating a modified version of the input image by applying a first set of filters to the input image when the input image is associated with sandworm spawning and applying a second set of filters to the input image when the input image is not associated with sandworm spawning. Further, the method includes displaying the modified version of the input image.

122.content: Instead, a key word had been drummed into the man's unconscious to immobilize his muscles at a critical instant. Feyd-Rautha rolled the vital word in his mind, mouthing it without sound: "Scum!" To the audience, it would appear that an un-drugged slave had been slipped into the arena to kill the na-Baron. And all the carefully arranged evidence would point to the slavemaster. A low humming arose from the red door's servomotors as they were armed for opening.
122.title: House Harkonnen feyd-rautha
122.abstract: (Compounds) and their methods of use are provided. In particular, compounds of the formula (I): or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt thereof, wherein R1, R2, R3, R4, R5, R6, R7, R8, R9, R10, R11, R12, R13, R14, R15, R16, R17, R18, R19, R20, R21, R22, R23, R24, R25, R26, R27, R28, R29, R30, R31, R32, R33, R34, R35, R36, R37, R38, R39, R40, R41, R42, R43,

123.content: This was a likely place-- deep in rock walls and facing another cliff some four kilometers away--far enough above the desert to avoid worms but close enough for easy access before a crossing. She turned, seeing that Paul had the tent up, its rib-domed hemisphere blending with the rock walls of the fissure.
123.title: Sandworms of Arrakis (The Dune Saga, Book 1): Dune Summary:Paul Atreides of House Atreides, born in the year 10,191 AG (After Gu
123.abstract: An electronic device is provided. The electronic device includes a display, a memory configured to store at least one program, and a processor configured to execute the at least one program stored in the memory so as to control the electronic device to be operated in any one mode from among a plurality of modes including a first mode for outputting an image through the display or a second mode for outputting sound through the display.

124.content: Paul emerged into a shallow depression in the Shield Wall's surface. It was a place about thirty meters in diameter and some three meters deep, a natural feature of the rock that the Fremen had hidden beneath a translucent camouflage cover. Communications equipment was clustered around a hole in the wall to the right. Fedaykin guards deployed through the depression waited for Muad'Dib's command to attack. Two men emerged from the hole by the communications equipment, spoke to the guards there. Paul glanced at Stilgar, nodded in the direction of the two men. "Get their report, Stil."
124.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for battle of Arrakeen
124.abstract: A method includes receiving an input from a user to play a game. The method further includes determining that the user is eligible to participate in a battle of Arrakeen associated with the game. The method further includes identifying one or more other users who are also eligible to participate in the battle of Arrakeen. The method further includes providing information about the battle of Arrakeen to each of the one or more other users. The method further includes enabling the user to select at least one opponent among the one or more other users. The method further includes initiating the battle of Arrakeen between the user and the selected at least one opponent. The method further includes transmitting results of the battle of Arrakeen to each of the user and the selected at least one opponent.

125.content: He adjusted their internal pressure with a quick twist, focused the oil lenses on the other cliff lifting golden tan in morning light across open sand. Jessica watched as he studied that apocalyptic landscape, his eyes probing into sand rivers and canyons. "There are growing things over there," he said. Jessica found the spare binoculars in the pack beside the tent, moved up beside Paul. "There," he said, holding the binoculars with one hand and pointing with the other. She looked where he pointed.
125.title: Systems and methods for identifying objects of interest in an aerial image
125.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for identifying objects of interest in an aerial image. In one implementation, the method includes receiving data associated with an object of interest located in an aerial image captured by an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), wherein the UAV captures the aerial image while hovering over the object of interest. The method also includes determining that the object of interest is within a predetermined distance from the UAV during capture of the aerial image.

126.content: From deep in the acoustical horn, the old woman's voice came out to them, an amplified whisper, harsh and penetrating: "Chani has returned from her hajra-- Chani has seen the waters." A sussurant response arose from the crowd: "She has seen the waters." "I consecrate the daughter of Liet in the Sayyadina," husked the old woman. "She is accepted," the crowd responded.
126.title: Method and apparatus for performing a hajra
126.abstract: A method of performing a hajra includes receiving, by a computing device from a user, an indication to perform the hajra. The method also includes determining, by the computing device in response to receipt of the indication, one or more parameters associated with the hajra. The method further includes generating, by the computing device using the one or more parameters, a three-dimensional (3D) representation of the hajra. The method additionally includes displaying, by the computing device, the 3D representation of the hajra during performance of the hajra. Further, the method includes receiving, by the computing device from the user, feedback related to the hajra after display of the 3D representation of the hajra. Finally, the method includes updating, by the computing device, the 3D representation of the hajra based on the received feedback. An apparatus for performing a hajra is also disclosed

127.content: He motioned flankers down to open segments along the side and keep the worm on a straight course as it rolled. When he had it turned, he motioned two steersmen out of the line and into positions ahead. "Ach, haiiiii-yoh!" he shouted in the traditional call. The left-side steersman opened a ring segment there. In a majestic circle, the maker turned to protect its opened segment.
127.title: Method and apparatus for controlling movement of a maker
127.abstract: A method is provided for controlling the movement of a marker. The method comprises detecting, by at least one image sensor, an object within a predetermined range of the marker; in response to detecting the object, determining whether or not the detected object corresponds to a pre-determined type of object; when it is determined that the detected object corresponds to the pre-determined type of object, causing the marker to move so as to position the marker outside the predetermined range with respect to the object corresponding to the pre-determined type of object.

128.content: "The Arrakeen environment built itself into the evolutionary pattern of native life forms," his father said. "How strange that so few people ever looked up from the spice long enough to wonder at the near-ideal nitrogen-oxygen-CO2 balance being maintained here in the absence of large areas of plant cover. The energy sphere of the planet is there to see and understand--a relentless process, but a process nonetheless. There is a gap in it? Then something occupies that gap. Science is made up of so many things that appear obvious after they are explained. I knew the little maker was there, deep in the sand, long before I ever saw it."
128.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing sandworms of Arrakis are disclosed herein. According to some embodiments, a method for managing sandworms of Arrakis may include receiving
128.abstract: (i) an indication that a first sandworm of Arrakis is attacking a second sandworm of Arrakis; (ii) one or more characteristics associated with the first sandworm of Arrakis; and (iii) one or more characteristics associated with the second sandworm of Arrakis. The method may further include determining whether the first sandworm of Arrakis should be permitted to continue attacking the second sandworm of Arrakis based at least in part on the one or more characteristics associated with the first sandworm of Arrakis and the one or more characteristics associated with the second sandworm of Arrakis.

129.content: She went through the quick regimen of calmness -- the two deep breaths, the ritual thought, then: "When I assign rooms, is there anything special I should reserve for you?" "You must teach me someday how you do that," he said, "the way you thrust your worries aside and turn to practical matters. It must be a Bene Gesserit thing." "It's a female thing," she said.
129.title: Method and apparatus for assigning rooms in a hotel or other lodging facility
129.abstract: A method of assigning guest rooms to reservations is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, a plurality of room requests from a plurality of guests; determining, by the computing device, one or more characteristics associated with each of the plurality of received room requests; comparing, by the computing device, the one or more characteristics associated with at least two of the plurality of received room requests; identifying, by the computing device, an available room assignment that satisfies the one or more characteristics associated with the at least two of the plurality of received room requests; and transmitting, by the computing device, information related to the identified available room assignment to be displayed via a graphical user interface (GUI). Corresponding apparatus, systems, methods, and computer program products are also disclosed.

130.content: "It was lines of movement that gave us the first clue to the relationship between worms and spice," his father said. A worm, Kynes thought with a surge of hope. A maker's sure to come when this bubble bursts.
130.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for sandworms and the eruption of Arrakis. In some implementations, a computer-implemented method is provided for
130.abstract: Method implemented at least in part via hardware comprising one or more processors and memory storing one or more instructions that when executed by the processor(s), the processor(s) perform operations comprising: receiving an input from a user; processing the input to determine whether the input corresponds to a command to initiate a battle between two worms; if the input does not correspond to a command to initiate a battle between two worms, then determining whether the input corresponds to a command to spawn a new worm; if the input does not correspond to a command to spawn a new worm, then determining whether the input corresponds to a command to move a worm; if the input does not correspond to a command to move a worm, then determining whether the input corresponds to a command to attack another worm; if the input does not correspond to a command to attack another worm, then determining whether the input corresponds to a command to evolve a

131.content: Paul glanced up at the darkening sky, said: "Gurney, have the south wall observers pulled out." He had to repeat his order, shouting above the growing noise of the storm. Gurney turned to obey. Paul fastened his face filter, tightened the stillsuit hood. Gurney returned. Paul touched his shoulder, pointed to the blast trigger set into the tunnel mouth beyond the signalmen. Gurney went into the tunnel, stopped there, one hand at the trigger, his gaze on Paul.
131.title: Apollo 13: a thrilling tale of disaster, courage, and survival
131.abstract: The Apollo 13: A Thrilling Tale of Disaster, Courage, and Survival is a book that tells the story of the Apollo 13 mission, which was aborted due to an explosion in the spacecraft's service module. The book focuses on the bravery and ingenuity of the astronauts as they struggled to bring their crippled spacecraft safely back to Earth.

132.content: "How many G's does this place pull? Feels heavy." "Nine-tenths of a G by the book." The crossfire of thrown words filled the big room.
132.title: Apparatus and method for measuring g-forces experienced by an occupant of a vehicle
132.abstract: A system is disclosed that includes at least one sensor configured to measure acceleration, velocity, or both. The system also includes a processor in communication with the at least one sensor. The processor is configured to receive data from the at least one sensor indicative of acceleration, velocity, or both measured by the at least one sensor over a predetermined period of time. The processor is further configured to calculate a G-Force associated with each measurement of acceleration, velocity, or both made by the at least one sensor during the predetermined period of time.

133.content: It's from those suits they wear -- call them 'stillsuits' -- that reclaim the body's own water." Paul swallowed, suddenly aware of the moisture in his mouth, remembering a dream of thirst. That people could want so for water they had to recycle their body moisture struck him with a feeling of desolation.
133.title: Stillsuit and methods of use thereof
133.abstract: A stillsuit is disclosed. The stillsuit includes a garment having an inner layer, an outer layer connected to the inner layer, wherein at least one of the inner layer or the outer layer comprises a moisture-wicking material configured to wick perspiration away from the wearer's body when worn by the wearer; and a plurality of cooling elements positioned between the inner layer and the outer layer such that the plurality of cooling elements are in thermal communication with the wearer's body when worn by the wearer. A method of using the stillsuit is also disclosed.

134.content: (This is the source of the Fremen saying: "Speed comes from Shaitan." Consider: for every one hundred calories of heat generated by exercise [speed] the body evaporates about six ounces of perspiration. The Fremen word for perspiration is bakka or tears and, in one pronunciation, translates: "The life essence that Shaitan squeezes from your soul.")
134.title: Apparatus and method for cooling a wearer's head during physical exertion
134.abstract: A system is provided for cooling a wearer's head during physical exertion. The system includes a plurality of tubes, each tube having a proximal end and a distal end opposite the proximal end. Each tube also has an inner lumen extending from the proximal end to the distal end. At least two of the plurality of tubes are coupled together at their proximal ends such that fluid can be circulated between the connected tubes. A refrigeration unit is in thermal communication with one or more of the plurality of tubes so as to transfer heat from the refrigeration unit to the one or more of the plurality of tubes.

135.content: The Baron moved down the length of the hall with that peculiar waddling-glide imparted by the necessities of guiding suspensor-hung weight. His jowls bobbed up and down; the suspensors jiggled and shifted beneath his orange robe. Rings glittered on his hands and opafires shone where they had been woven into the robe.
135.title: Method and apparatus for maneuvering a suspensor-bearing entity in a three-dimensional environment
135.abstract: A method of maneuvering a suspensor-bearing entity (e.g., an unmanned aerial vehicle) in a three-dimensional environment is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of receiving sensor data from one or more sensors associated with the suspensor-bearing entity, wherein the sensor data includes information regarding at least one object in the three-dimensional environment; processing the received sensor data to generate processed sensor data that includes updated information regarding the at least one object in the three-dimensional environment; comparing the updated information regarding the at least one object in the three-dimensional environment included in the processed sensor data with previously stored information regarding the at least one object in the three-dimensional environment; and controlling movement of the suspensor-bearing entity relative to the at least one object in the three-dimensional environment based on the results of the comparison step.

136.content: (Water is poisonous to shai-hulud as the Fremen had long known from drowning the rare "stunted worm" of the Minor Erg to produce the awareness-spectrum narcotic they call Water of Life. The "stunted worm" is a primitive form of shai-hulud that reaches a length of only about nine meters.) Now they had the circular relationship: little maker to pre-spice mass; little maker to shai-hulud; shai-hulud to scatter the spice upon which fed microscopic creatures called sand plankton; the sand plankton, food for shai-hulud, growing, burrowing, becoming little makers. Kynes and his people turned their attention from these great relationships and focused now on micro-ecology. First, the climate: the sand surface often reached temperatures of 344° to 350° (absolute).
136.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for sandworms of Arrakis: how Dune's ecology works. In accordance with some embodiments,
136.abstract: A method comprising: (a) receiving an input from a user; (b) in response to the input, identifying one or more words that are similar to the input; (c) determining whether at least one of the identified words is included in a list of prohibited words; (d) if so, modifying the received input by replacing the determined word(s) with a synonym thereof; and (e) presenting the modified input as a search result. A non-transitory computer-readable storage medium storing instructions executable by one or more processors conveying outcomes of methods described herein. And other related structures, articles, devices and/or phenomena are terms used to describe one or more mechanical, electrical, electronic, magnetic, semiconductor, optical, biochemical and/or software structures, articles, devices and/or phenomena that exhibit the respective intangible or tangible properties and/or rel

137.content: The way a slave cocked his head could give the most vital clue to counter and feint. The red door slammed open. Out charged a tall, muscular man with shaved head and darkly pitted eyes.
137.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an intruder in a dwelling
137.abstract: A method of detecting an intruder in a dwelling, the method comprising obtaining (i) motion data indicative of movement of at least one occupant of the dwelling over a period of time; (ii) audio data representative of sounds within the dwelling over the period of time; and (iii) video data representative of visual activity within the dwelling over the period of time. The method further comprises analysing the motion data to determine whether there has been any unusual or unexplained change in the behaviour of the at least one occupant during the period of time. The method further comprises analysing the audio data to determine whether there has been any unusual or unexplained sound within the dwelling during the period of time. The method further comprises analysing the video data to determine whether there has been any unusual or unexplained visual activity within the dwelling during the period of time.

138.content: "The storm is on them and our gunners already are firing." Paul thought of the storm sweeping across the basin, the static charge within the wall of sand that destroyed every shield barrier in the enemy camp. "The storm!" someone shouted.
138.title: Apparatus, system, and method for detecting and mitigating sandstorms
138.abstract: According to some embodiments, an apparatus is provided. The apparatus includes one or more processors configured to execute computer-readable instructions stored in non-transitory memory coupled with the one or more processors. The computer-readable instructions are configured to instruct the one or more processors to perform operations comprising obtaining meteorological data associated with a geographic area; determining that a predetermined threshold of the meteorological data exceeds a predetermined threshold value; identifying at least one location within the geographic area corresponding to the predetermined threshold being exceeded by the predetermined threshold value; and outputting information indicative of the identified at least one location.

139.content: He added another pinch of spice to the container, sent the foam boiling around Jessica's hands as she began cutting a vertical face in the upper slant of the hole. On the second pass, her hands encountered something hard. Slowly, she worked out a length of strap with a plastic buckle.
139.title: Apparatus and method for securing a lid to a container
139.abstract: A cap-securing apparatus is disclosed. The apparatus comprises an elongated body having a first end and a second end opposite the first end, wherein at least one of the first end or the second end includes a gripping surface configured to securely engage with a rim of a container in order to prevent rotation of the cap relative to the container; and a plurality of protrusions extending radially outward from the elongated body between the first end and the second end, wherein the plurality of protrusions are spaced equidistantly around the circumference of the elongated body.

140.content: He says you have a nicety of awareness -- in his own words -- of the difference between a blade's edge and its tip." "Gurney says there's no artistry in killing with the tip, that it should be done with the edge."
140.title: Method and apparatus for sharpening a knife blade
140.abstract: A method of sharpening a knife blade is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (a) providing a plurality of abrasive particles, wherein at least some of the abrasive particles have an elongated shape; (b) arranging the abrasive particles in a predetermined pattern to form a grinding wheel; (c) rotating the grinding wheel about an axis normal to a surface of the grinding wheel so as to cause relative movement between the grinding wheel and the knife blade; and (d) contacting the knife blade with the grinding wheel such that the abrasive particles remove material from the knife blade thereby sharpening the knife blade. An apparatus for sharpening a knife blade is also disclosed.

141.content: "The way they're cutting up the desert . . . it's as though they were making certain they stamped out whatever's there . . . the way you'd stamp out a nest of insects." "Or a nest of Atreides," Jessica said.
141.title: Sandworms of Dune
141.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for generating sandworms are provided. The method may include receiving an input to generate a sandworm from a plurality of genetically modified organisms (GMOs), wherein each GMO is associated with one or more traits. The method may further include determining that the input satisfies at least one predetermined criterion. In response to determining that the input satisfies the at least one predetermined criterion, the method may include combining two or more GMOs into a single sandworm according to probabilities assigned to combinations of GMOs satisfying the at least one predetermined criterion.

142.content: DAR AL-HIKMAN: school of religious translation or interpretation. DARK THINGS: idiomatic for the infectious superstitions taught by the Missionaria Protectiva to susceptible civilizations. DEATH TRIPOD: originally; the tripod upon which desert executioners hanged their victims. By usage: the three members of a Cherem sworn to the same revenge. DERCH: right turn; a worm steersman's call. DEW COLLECTORS or DEW PRECIPITATORS: not to be confused with dew gatherers. Collectors or precipitators are egg-shaped devices about four centimeters on the long axis. They are made of chromoplastic that turns a reflecting white when subjected to light, and reverts to transparency in darkness. The collector forms a markedly cold surface upon which dawn dew will precipitate. They are used by Fremen to line concave planting depressions where they provide a small but reliable source of water. DEW GATHERERS: workers who reap dew from the plants of Arrakis, using a scythelike dew reaper. DEMIBROTHERS: sons of concubines in the same household and certified as having the same father. DICTUM FAMILIA: that rule of the Great Convention which prohibits the slaying of a royal person or member of a Great House by informal treachery. The rule sets up the formal outline and limits the means of assassination. DISTRANS: a device for producing a temporary neural imprint on the nervous system of Chiroptera or birds. The creature's normal cry then carries the message imprint which can be sorted from that carrier wave by another distrans. DRUM SAND: impaction of sand in such away that any sudden blow against its surface produces a distinct drum sound. DOORSEAL: a portable plastic hermetic seal used for moisture security in Fremen overday cave camps. DUMP BOXES: the general term for any cargo container of irregular shape and equipped with ablation surfaces and suspensor damping system. They are used to dump material from space onto a planet's surface. DUNE MEN: idiomatic for open sand workers, spice hunters and the like on Arrakis. Sandworkers. Spiceworkers. DUST CHASM: any deep crevasse or depression on the desert of Arrakis that has been filled with dust not apparently different from the surrounding surface; a deadly trap because human or animal will sink in it and smother. (See Tidal Dust Basin.) ECAZ: fourth planet of Alpha Centauri B; the sculptors' paradise, so called because it is the home of fogwood, the plant growth capable of being shaped in situ solely by the power of human thought. EGO-LIKENESS: portraiture reproduced through a shigawire projector that is capable of reproducing subtle movements said to convey the ego essence. ELACCA DRUG: narcotic formed by burning blood-grained elacca wood of Ecas. Its effect is to remove most of the will to self-preservation. Druggee skin shows a characteristic carrot color. Commonly used to prepare slave gladiators for the ring. EL-SAYAL: the "rain of sand." A fall of dust which has been carried to medium altitude (around 2,000 meters) by a coriolis storm. El-sayals frequently bring moisture to ground level. ERG: an extensive dune area, a sea of sand. FAI: the water tribute, chief specie of tax on Arrakis. FANMETAL: metal formed by the growing of jasmium crystals in duraluminum; noted for extreme tensile strength in relationship to weight. Name derives from its common use in collapsible structures that are opened by "fanning" them out. FAUFRELUCHES; the rigid rule of class distinction enforced by the Imperium. "A place for every man and every man in his place." FEDAYKIN: Fremen death commandos; historically: a group formed and pledged to give their lives to right a wrong. FILMBOOK: any shigawire imprint used in training and carrying a mnemonic pulse. FILT-PLUG: a nose filter unit worn with a stillsuit to capture moisture from the exhaled breath. FIQH: knowledge, religious law; one of the half-legendary origins of the Zensunni Wanderers' religion. FIRE, PILLAR OF: a simple pyrocket for signaling across the open desert. FIRST MOON: the major satellite of Arrakis, first to rise in the night; notable for a distinct human fist pattern on its surface. FREE TRADERS: idiomatic for smugglers. FREMEN: the free tribes of Arrakis, dwellers in the desert, remnants of the Zensunni Wanderers. ("Sand Pirates" according to the Imperial Dictionary.) FREMKIT: desert survival kit of Fremen manufacture. FRIGATE: largest spaceship that can be grounded on a planet and taken off in one piece. GALACH: official language of the Imperium. Hybrid Inglo-Slavic with strong traces of cultural-specialization terms adopted during the long chain of human migrations. GAMONT: third planet of Niushe; noted for its hedonistic culture and exotic sexual practices. GARE: butte. GATHERING: distinguished from Council Gathering. It is a formal convocation of Fremen leaders to witness a combat that determines tribal leadership. (A Council Gathering is an assembly to arrive at decisions involving all the tribes.) GEYRAT: straight ahead; a worm steersman's call. GHAFLA: giving oneself up to gadfly distractions. Thus: a changeable person, one not to be trusted. GHANIMA: something acquired in battle or single combat. Commonly, a memento of combat kept only to stir the memory. GIEDI PRIME: the planet of Ophiuchi B (36), homeworld of House Harkonnen.
142.title: DUNE, BOOK ONE OF THE DUNE CHRONICLES
142.abstract: A method of treating or preventing an infection is provided. The method comprises administering to a mammal suffering from or at risk of developing an infection one or more doses of a pharmaceutical composition comprising (i) Lactobacillus plantarum strain NCIMB 8824; and (ii) Staphylococcus epidermidis strain ATCC 12278. Also provided is a pharmaceutical composition comprising (i) Lactobacillus plantarum strain NCIMB 8824; and (ii) Staphylococcus epidermidis strain ATCC 12278.

143.content: A twisting burrow-mound of sand cut through the dunes within their field of vision. The mound lifted in front, dusting away like a bow wave in water.
143.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and locating buried objects using ground penetrating radar (GPR)
143.abstract: A method of operating a ground penetrating radar (GPR) system includes receiving GPR data from the GPR system, wherein the GPR data is indicative of one or more subsurface anomalies detected by the GPR system. The method also includes processing the GPR data to determine an object type associated with at least one of the one or more subsurface anomalies. The method further includes determining a location of each of the one or more subsurface anomalies in response to determining the object type associated with each of the one or more subsurface anomalies. In addition, the method includes outputting information corresponding to the location of each of the one or more subsurface anomalies as well as the object type associated with each of the one or more subsurface anomalies.

144.content: His trained eyes saw her readiness for battle, the waiting whipsnap of her muscles. "It would be regrettable should we have to destroy you out of hand," the voice above them said. That's the one who spoke to us first, Jessica thought. There are at least two of them--one to our right and one on our left. "Cignoro hrobosa sukares hin mange la pchagavas doi me kamavas na beslas lele pal hrobas!" It was the man to their right calling out across the basin. To Paul, the words were gibberish, but out of her Bene Gesserit training, Jessica recognized the speech. It was Chakobsa, one of the ancient hunting languages, and the man above them was saying that perhaps these were the strangers they sought. In the sudden silence that followed the calling voice, the hoop-wheel face of the second moon--faintly ivory blue--rolled over the rocks across the basin, bright and peering. Scrambling sounds came from the rocks--above and to both sides . . . dark motions in the moonlight. Many figures flowed through the shadows.
144.title: Dune: The Sisterhood of Dune
144.abstract: A novel featuring the Bene Gesserit Sisterhood, written by Frank Herbert's son and daughter-in-law.

145.content: For Paul, she knew, she should take that spout and drink of the sack's contents, but as she bent to the proffered spout, her senses told her its peril. The stuff in the sack had a bitter smell subtly akin to many poisons that she knew, but unlike them, too.
145.title: Method and apparatus for detecting a poisonous substance in a beverage
145.abstract: A method of detecting a poisonous substance in a beverage, the method comprising providing a sample of the beverage to an analyzer; wherein the analyzer comprises at least one light source configured to emit electromagnetic radiation having a wavelength ranging from about 200 nm to about 1600 nm towards the sample such that some of the electromagnetic radiation is absorbed by compounds present in the sample which are indicative of the presence of the poisonous substance.

146.content: "It's the way," he muttered. "It's the way to kill offworld strangers found in the desert and take their water as a gift from Shai-hulud," Paul said.
146.title: Method and apparatus for locating an offworlder in the desert of Arrakis
146.abstract: A method is provided for locating an offworlder in the desert of Arrakis. The method includes receiving, at a computing device, one or more signals from a plurality of beacons positioned throughout the desert of Arrakis; determining, by the computing device, a location of each of the plurality of beacons using the one or more signals received from each of the plurality of beacons; generating, by the computing device, a three-dimensional (3D) model of the desert of Arrakis including locations of the plurality of beacons; identifying, by the computing device, a path through the 3D model of the desert of Arrakis to locate the offworlder; and directing, by the computing device, a sandworm to follow the path through the 3D model of the desert of Arrakis to locate the offworlder.

147.content: He snapped his fingers and a door opened at his left behind the throne. Through the door came two Sardaukar herding a girl-child who appeared to be about four years old. She wore a black aba, the hood thrown back to reveal the attachments of a stillsuit hanging free at her throat. Her eyes were Fremen blue, staring out of a soft, round face.
147.title: Dune: House Atreides (Dune: House Atreides Book 1)
147.abstract: A novel entitled Dune: House Atreides (Dune: House Atreides Book 1).

148.content: "If it is the Lisan al-Gaib you serve, as you have said it, why raise mourning cries? The memory of one who died in this fashion will live as long as the memory of man endures." But Hawat's men advanced, angry looks on their faces. One had captured a lasgun. He started to draw it.
148.title: Battle of Alamut: A novel of the Thousand and One Nights (The Thousand and One Nights Book 1)
148.abstract: A new English translation of The Thousand and One Nights.

149.content: Storms, sand-static, and all that, you know. Navigation markers are knocked out faster than they can be installed." "We'll discuss various types of static another time," the Count said. Ah-h-h-h, the Baron thought.
149.title: Systems and methods for navigating a vehicle in an adverse environment
149.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for navigating a vehicle in an adverse environment. In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data from sensors associated with a vehicle; processing the sensor data to identify objects within a vicinity of the vehicle; identifying at least one hazardous object among the identified objects; determining whether the at least one hazardous object poses a threat to the vehicle; responsive to determining that the at least one hazardous object does not pose a threat to the vehicle, transmitting instructions to steer the vehicle away from the at least one hazardous object; and responsive to determining that the at least one hazardous object poses a threat to the vehicle, preventing movement of the vehicle toward the at least one hazardous object.

150.content: Great store is set on Imperial Conditioning. It's assumed that ultimate conditioning cannot be removed without killing the subject. However, as someone once observed, given the right lever you can move a planet. We found the lever that moved the doctor." "How?" Feyd-Rautha asked. He found this a fascinating subject. Everyone knew you couldn't subvert Imperial Conditioning! "Another time," the Baron said. "Continue, Piter." "In place of Yueh," Piter said, "we'll drag a most interesting suspect across Hawat's path. The very audacity of this suspect will recommend her to Hawat's attention."
150.title: Apparatus and method for imperial conditioning
150.abstract: Implementations of apparatuses and methods for imperial conditioning are disclosed herein. In one implementation, an apparatus for imperial conditioning includes a plurality of sensors configured to generate sensor data indicative of at least one aspect of the environment in which the apparatus is located. The apparatus also includes a processor coupled to the plurality of sensors. The processor is configured to receive the sensor data from the plurality of sensors; determine whether the received sensor data satisfies predetermined environmental conditions; and responsive to determining that the received sensor data satisfies the predetermined environmental conditions, initiate an imperial conditioning process. Implementations of computer-implemented methods for imperial conditioning are also disclosed herein. Numerous other aspects are described in the claims, drawings, and text which provide a more thorough understanding of the instant solutions.

151.content: "The plan would go ahead without me. We must wait for the --" "I'm getting a message, Muad'Dib," said the signalman at the communications equipment. The man shook his head, pressed a receiver phone against his ear. "Much static!" He began scribbling on a pad in front of him, shaking his head waiting, writing . . . waiting.
151.title: Method and apparatus for communication with an alien life form
151.abstract: A method of communicating with an alien life form is disclosed. The method includes receiving, from the alien life form, one or more electromagnetic signals transmitted by the alien life form; analyzing the one or more electromagnetic signals to determine at least one characteristic associated with the alien life form; determining whether the at least one characteristic indicates that the alien life form poses a threat to humanity; and in response to determining that the at least one characteristic does not indicate that the alien life form poses a threat to humanity, initiating a communication session with the alien life form. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

153.content: When we withdraw the antidote, death will sheathe him." "In a way, it's like the arena," Feyd-Rautha said. "Feints within feints within feints. You watch to see which way the gladiator leans, which way he looks, how he holds his knife." He nodded to himself, seeing that these words pleased his uncle, but thinking: Yes! Like the arena! And the cutting edge is the mind! "Now you see how you need me," the Baron said. "I'm yet of use, Feyd." A sword to be wielded until he's too blunt for use, Feyd-Rautha thought.

154.content: In the desert, you must travel by night and rest in shade through the day." Remembered lore insinuated itself into Jessica's mind: Without a stillsuit, a man sitting in shade on the desert needs five liters of water a day to maintain body weight. She felt the slick-soft skin of the stillsuit against her body, thinking how their lives depended on these garments.
154.title: Stillsuits for use in a hostile environment
154.abstract: A stillsuit is provided that includes an outer layer and an inner layer. The outer layer can be formed of a breathable material such as nylon or spandex, and the inner layer can be formed of a moisture-wicking material such as polypropylene.

155.content: The mutated poverty grasses were planted first along the downwind (slipface) of the chosen dunes that stood across the path of the prevailing westerlies. With the downwind face anchored, the windward face grew higher and higher and the grass was moved to keep pace. Giant sifs (long dunes with sinuous crest) of more than 1,500 meters height were produced this way. When barrier dunes reached sufficient height, the windward faces were planted with tougher sword grasses. Each structure on a base about six times as thick as its height was anchored -- "fixed." Now, they came in with deeper plantings -- ephemerals (chenopods, pigweeds, and amaranth to begin), then scotch broom, low lupine, vine eucalyptus (the type adapted for Caladan's northern reaches), dwarf tamarisk, shore pine -- then the true desert growths: candelilla, saguaro, and bis-naga, the barrel cactus. Where it would grow, they introduced camel sage, onion grass, gobi feather grass, wild alfalfa, burrow bush, sand verbena, evening primrose, incense bush, smoke tree, creosote bush. They turned then to the necessary animal life -- burrowing creatures to open the soil and aerate it: kit fox, kangaroo mouse, desert hare, sand terrapin . . . and the predators to keep them in check: desert hawk, dwarf owl, eagle and desert owl; and insects to fill the niches these couldn't reach: scorpion, centipede, trapdoor spider, the biting wasp and the wormfly . . . and the desert bat to keep watch on these. Now came the crucial test: date palms, cotton, melons, coffee, medicinals -- more than 200 selected food plant types to test and adapt. "The thing the ecologically illiterate don't realize about an ecosystem," Kynes said, "is that it's a system. A system! A system maintains a certain fluid stability that can be destroyed by a misstep in just one niche. A system has order, a flowing from point to point. If something dams that flow, order collapses. The untrained might miss that collapse until it was too late. That's why the highest function of ecology is the understanding of consequences." Had they achieved a system? Kynes and his people watched and waited. The Fremen now knew what he meant by an open-end prediction to five hundred years. A report came up from the palmaries: At the desert edge of the plantings, the sand plankton is being poisoned through interaction with the new forms of life.
155.title: Method and apparatus for terraforming a planet or other body and, more specifically, a method and apparatus for terraforming a planet or other body using giant sifs
155.abstract: A method of terraforming a planet or other body includes the steps of (a) providing a plurality of asteroids; (b) launching the plurality of asteroids into an orbit around the planet or other body; (c) directing the plurality of asteroids to impact portions of the surface of the planet or other body so as to form at least one depression in the surface of the planet or other body; and (d) filling the at least one depression with water.

156.content: BAKLAWA: a heavy pastry made with date syrup. BALISET: a nine-stringed musical instrument, lineal descendant of the zither, tuned to the Chusuk scale and played by strumming. Favorite instrument of Imperial troubadours. BARADYE PISTOL: a static-charge dust gun developed on Arrakis for laying down a large dye marker area on sand. BARAKA: a living holy man of magical powers. BASHAR (often Colonel Bashar): an officer of the Sardaukar a fractional point above Colonel in the standardized military classification. Rank created for military ruler of a planetary subdistrict.
156.title: A visitor's guide to the world of Frank Herbert's Dune
156.abstract: The present disclosure relates to systems and methods for providing an augmented reality (AR) experience. In some embodiments, one or more processors may be configured to receive location information associated with a user device; determine that the user device is located within a predetermined proximity of at least one physical object; in response to determining that the user device is located within the predetermined proximity of the at least one physical object, cause display of AR content via the user device corresponding to the at least one physical object; wherein the AR content causes interaction between the user device and the at least one physical object when the user device is located within the predetermined proximity of the at least one physical object. Various other aspects are contemplated.

157.content: = = = = = = "There is no escape--we pay for the violence of our ancestors. " -from "The Collected Sayings of Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan Jessica heard the disturbance in the great hall, turned on the light beside her bed. The clock there had not been properly adjusted to local time, and she had to subtract twenty-one minutes to determine that it was about 2 A.M. The disturbance was loud and incoherent. Is this the Harkonnen attack? she wondered. She slipped out of bed, checked the screen monitors to see where her family was.
157.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for battle of Arrakeen
157.abstract: A method includes receiving an input from a user. The method also includes determining that the user is eligible to participate in a battle of Arrakeen associated with Game of Thrones (GoT). The method further includes selecting one or more other users who are eligible to participate in the battle of Arrakeen. The method additionally includes initiating the battle of Arrakeen between the user and the one or more other users. The method still further includes awarding at least one reward to the user upon completion of the battle of Arrakeen. Corresponding methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

158.content: A spill of sand spread its brief curtain across the open end of the fissure. The sand hissed down, loosed by puffs of morning breeze, by the hawks that were beginning to lift away from the clifftop.
158.title: Apparatus and method for sealing an opening in a subterranean formation
158.abstract: An apparatus for sealing an opening in a subterranean formation includes a mandrel having a first end and a second end opposite the first end. A plurality of sleeves are disposed about the mandrel between the first end and the second end, wherein each of the plurality of sleeves is coupled to the mandrel such that the plurality of sleeves can slide along the mandrel from the first end to the second end. Each of the plurality of sleeves extends radially outward from the mandrel at least partially around the circumference of the mandrel.

159.content: But it must be: the needs of the tribe are paramount." "What--" "Remain silent and accept!" Experiences began to unroll before Jessica. It was like a lecture strip in a subliminal training projector at the Bene Gesserit school . . . but faster . . . blindingly faster. Yet . . . distinct. She knew each experience as it happened: there was a lover--virile, bearded, with the Fremen eyes, and Jessica saw his strength and tenderness, all of him in one blink-moment, through the Reverend Mother's memory. There was no time now to think of what this might be doing to the daughter fetus, only time to accept and record. The experiences poured in on Jessica-- birth, life, death--important matters and unimportant, an outpouring of single-view time. Why should a fall of sand from a clifftop stick in the memory? she asked herself. Too late, Jessica saw what was happening: the old woman was dying and, in dying, pouring her experiences into Jessica's awareness as water is poured into a cup. The other mote faded back into pre-birth awareness as Jessica watched it.
159.title: Method and apparatus for inducing a state of consciousness in a subject by exposing the subject to sensory stimuli associated with that state of consciousness and measuring a physiological response of the subject to the sensory stimuli
159.abstract: A method, system and apparatus are disclosed for inducing a state of consciousness in a subject. The method comprises presenting one or more sensory stimuli to the subject; measuring a physiological response of the subject to the one or more sensory stimuli; determining whether the measured physiological response is indicative of an induced state of consciousness; and if the measured physiological response is determined to be indicative of an induced state of consciousness, then terminating presentation of the one or more sensory stimuli to the subject.

160.content: ORNITHOPTER (commonly: 'thopter): any aircraft capable of sustained wingbeat flight in the manner of birds. OUT-FREYN: Galach for "immediately foreign," that is: not of your immediate community, not of the select. PALM LOCK: any lock or seal which may be opened on contact with the palm of the human hand to which it has been keyed. PAN: on Arrakis, any lowlying region or depression created by the subsiding of the underlying basement complex. (On planets with sufficient water, a pan indicates a region once covered by open water. Arrakis is believed to have at least one such area, although this remains open to argument.) PANOPLIA PROPHETICUS: term covering the infectious superstitions used by the Bene Gesserit to exploit primitive regions. (See Missionaria Protectiva.) PARACOMPASS: any compass that determines direction by local magnetic anomaly; used where relevant charts are available and where a planet's total magnetic field is unstable or subject to masking by severe magnetic storms. PENTASHIELD: a five-layer shield-generator field suitable for small areas such as doorways or passages (large reinforcing shields become increasingly unstable with each successive layer) and virtually impassable to anyone not wearing a dissembler tuned to the shield codes. (See Prudence Door.)
160.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for generating a glossary of terms used in Frank Herbert's Dune novels. In accordance with one or more embodiments of the present dis
160.abstract: methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for generating a glossary of terms used in Frank Herbert's Dune novels. In accordance with one or more embodiments of the present disclosure, methods are provided that include obtaining text from at least one of the Dune novels written by Frank Herbert; analyzing the text to identify words within the text; determining whether each identified word is included in a pre-existing glossary associated with the Dune novels; responsive to determining that the identified word is not included in the pre-existing glossary, adding the identified word to the pre-existing glossary; and storing the pre-existing glossary comprising the identified words.

Beneath them on the floor of the cave swirled a melee of struggling figures.

A corresponding system and computer program product are also disclosed.

"Through there and beyond, that's food processing and stillsuit maintenance."
163.title: Systems and methods for food processing and stillsuit maintenance in a space colony
163.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for food processing and Stillsuit maintenance in a space colony. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication that a user is wearing a garment comprising a breathable membrane configured to allow exhaled gases from the user to pass through the breathable membrane while preventing ingested fluids from passing through the breathable membrane. The method also includes detecting when the user has removed the garment. Responsive to detecting that the user has removed the garment, the method further includes determining whether the user is within a predetermined proximity of a food preparation unit (FPU). When the user is determined to be within the predetermined proximity of the FPU, the method additionally includes transmitting instructions to the FPU instructing the FPU to prepare meal(s) for consumption by the user.

A breath of fear touched his mind, and he forced himself to turn away from his mother, to look up the cliff.
164.title: Method and apparatus for catching fish

The method also includes deploying the plurality of lures into the water such that at least two of the plurality of lures are positioned substantially side-by-side within the water. The method additionally includes retrieving the plurality of lures from the water while simultaneously moving the plurality of lures relative to one another so as to form a school of fish behind the plurality of lures. Further, the method includes releasing the school of fish back into the water. An apparatus for catching fish is also disclosed.

168.content: Jessica smiled, feeling her fears retreat. She was suddenly caught by the idea of genetic traces in her son's features--her lines in eyes and facial outline, but sharp touches of the father peering through that outline like maturity emerging from childhood. She thought of the boy's features as an exquisite distillation out of random patterns--endless queues of happenstance meeting at this nexus.
168.title: Method and apparatus for identifying individuals based on facial features

Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

Based on the received sensor data, the processor may determine whether the ingredient has been contaminated with botulinum neurotoxin. Responsive to determining that the ingredient has been contaminated with botulinum neurotoxin, the processor may

172.title: Hunters of the Great Desert (Guardians of Dune Book 1)
172.abstract: A new novel in the Guardians of Dune series set between Frank Herbert's Dune and David Lynch's film Dune, from New York Times bestselling authors Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson.The desert planet Arrakis has been destroyed. Now, the Bene Gesserit, Spacing Guild, Empire, and House Corrino are free to fight it out for supremacy. The winner will write the history of Dune for years to come.

173.content: Where the dunes began, perhaps fifty meters away at the foot of a rock beach, a silver-gray curve broached from the desert, sending rivers of sand and dust cascading all around. 173.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing sandworms of Arrakis are disclosed herein. According to some embodiments, a method for managing sandworms of Arrakis may include receiving
173.abstract: (a) an indication of a first worm; (b) determining that the first worm is associated with a second worm; and (c) in response to determining that the first worm is associated with the second worm, identifying one or more third worms as descendants of at least one of the first worm or the second worm. In some embodiments, associating the first worm with the second worm indicates that the first worm was spawned by the second worm within a predetermined amount of time prior to receipt of the indication of the first worm.

174.title: Doorfield deactivation
174.abstract: Structures, methods, and systems are disclosed for doorfield deactivation. In some embodiments, the method may include detecting an object within a field of view (FOV) of at least one camera associated with a vehicle; determining that the detected object is in close proximity to a driver-side window of the vehicle; responsive to detection of the object and determining that the object is in close proximity to the driver-side window, controlling actuators of the vehicle to open the driver-side window such that the object passes out of the FOV through the opened driver-side window; while the object is passing out of the FOV through the opened driver-side window, preventing control signals from being transmitted to doors of the vehicle so as to disable operation of the doors; and after the object has passed out of the FOV through the opened driver-side window, closing the driver-side window.

175.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized intruders
175.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized intruder includes receiving, by a computing device, one or more biometric data associated with a user. The computing device determines whether the received one or more biometric data are authorized to access the computing device. In response to determining that the received one or more biometric data are not authorized to access the computing device, the computing device transmits a notification message indicating that the received one or more biometric data are not authorized to access the computing device. Additionally, in response to determining that the received one or more biometric data are authorized to access the computing device, the computing device allows the user to access the computing device using the received one or more biometric data.

176.title: Systems and methods for controlling light in a sleeping environment
176.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for controlling light in a sleeping environment. In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data associated with an occupant of a sleeping environment; detecting that the occupant has fallen asleep within the sleeping environment; responsive to detecting that the occupant has fallen asleep within the sleeping environment, determining at least one color temperature value from among a plurality of color temperature values corresponding to each of a plurality of times since the occupant last fell asleep within the sleeping environment; and emitting light having the determined at least one color temperature value into the sleeping environment while the occupant remains asleep within the sleeping environment.

177.content: She drained the cup, feeling the energy and lift of its contents -- hot and delicious. And she wondered what other society would have such a natural regard for her privacy and comfort that the giver would intrude only enough to deposit the gift and not inflict her with the donor? Respect and love had sent the gift -- with only a slight tinge of fear. Another element of the incident forced itself into her awareness: she had thought of coffee and it had appeared.
177.title: Method and apparatus for preparing and dispensing beverages
177.abstract: A method of making a cocktail is disclosed. The method includes the steps of (a) receiving an order to make a cocktail, wherein the cocktail comprises at least one first ingredient and at least one second ingredient; (b) determining a ratio of the at least one first ingredient to the at least one second ingredient in the cocktail; (c) mixing the at least one first ingredient and the at least one second ingredient according to the determined ratio so as to form a mixed drink; and (d) dispensing the mixed drink into a cup or glass.

Flying object at nine o'clock, Sector B. Do you identify it?" "It's merely a bird," Kynes said, and added: "You have sharp eyes." The panel speaker crackled, then: "Escort Gemma. Object examined under full amplification. It's a large bird." Paul looked in the indicated direction, saw the distant speck: a dot of intermittent motion, and realized how keyed up his father must be. Every sense was at full alert.

179.content: She waited in the seeming relaxation that made the Bene Gesserit-trained so terrifying in combat. Now we see which way the decision tips, she thought. Slowly, Mapes reached into the neck of her dress, brought out a dark sheath. A black handle with deep finger ridges protruded from it. She took sheath in one hand and handle in the other, withdrew a milk-white blade, held it up. The blade seemed to shine and glitter with a light of its own. It was double-edged like a kindjal and the blade was perhaps twenty centimeters long. "Do you know this, my Lady?" Mapes asked. It could only be one thing, Jessica knew, the fabled crysknife of Arrakis, the blade that had never been taken off the planet, and was known only by rumor and wild gossip. "It's a crysknife," she said. "Say it not lightly," Mapes said. "Do you know its meaning?" And Jessica thought: There was an edge to that question.
179.title: The present invention relates to a method for preparing crysknife (Bene Gesserit heirloom), wherein the method comprises the steps of: (a) obtaining a starting material comprising at least one

180.content: He slammed the power arm forward. Their 'thopter leaped like a frightened animal, surged southwest toward the storm and the great curve of desert. In the near distance, Paul saw scattered shadows telling where the line of rocks ended, the basement complex sinking beneath the dunes. Beyond stretched moonlit fingernail shadows--dunes diminishing one into another. And above the horizon climbed the flat immensity of the storm like a wall against the stars. Something jarred the 'thopter.
180.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining a location of a character in a science fiction adventure are disclosed herein. In one embodiment, a method for determining a location of a character in a science fiction
180.abstract: The present disclosure relates to systems and methods for providing an augmented reality (AR) experience to a user. For example, the AR system may be configured to receive image data from at least one camera associated with a computing device. The AR system may analyze the image data to determine whether there is an object within the image data that matches a predetermined object type. If so, the AR system may retrieve additional information related to the object matching the predetermined object type. The AR system may then generate an AR overlay including the additional information regarding the object matching the predetermined object type. The AR system may cause the AR overlay to be overlaid onto the image data such that the AR overlay is viewable by the user through the at least one camera.

181.content: -from "Manual of Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan It was a relief globe of a world, partly in shadows, spinning under the impetus of a fat hand that glittered with rings. The globe sat on a freeform stand at one wall of a windowless room whose other walls presented a patchwork of multicolored scrolls, filmbooks, tapes and reels. Light glowed in the room from golden balls hanging in mobile suspensor fields. An ellipsoid desk with a top of jade-pink petrified elacca wood stood at the center of the room. Veriform suspensor chairs ringed it, two of them occupied. In one sat a dark-haired youth of about sixteen years, round of face and with sullen eyes. The other held a slender, short man with effeminate face.
181.title: Apparatus and method for generating a three-dimensional (3D) virtual reality (VR) environment from a two-dimensional (2D) image
181.abstract: An apparatus is provided for generating a three-dimensional (3D) virtual reality (VR) environment from a two-dimensional (2D) image. The apparatus comprises at least one processor configured to receive the 2D image, wherein the 2D image depicts an object in a first viewpoint; generate a plurality of depth maps corresponding to different views of the object by processing the 2D image using a convolutional neural network that receives the 2D image as input data; process the plurality of depth maps with another convolutional neural network such that the other convolutional neural network receives the plurality of depth maps as input data so as to generate a 3D model of the object; and generate the 3D VR environment including the 3D model of the object.

182.content: SANDCRAWLER: general term for machinery designed to operate on the Arrakis surface in hunting and collecting melange. SANDMASTER: general superintendent of spice operations. SANDRIDER: Fremen term for one who is capable of capturing and riding a sandworm. SANDSNORK: breathing device for pumping surface air into a sandcovered stilltent. SANDTIDE: idiomatic for a dust tide: the variation in level within certain dust-filled basins on Arrakis due to gravitational effects of sun and satellites. (See Tidal Dust Basin.) SANDWALKER: any Fremen trained to survive in the open desert. SANDWORM: See Shai-Hulud.
182.title: Systems and methods for harvesting spice from Arrakis
182.abstract: Implementations of systems and methods for harvesting spice from Arrakis are described. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method includes receiving an input image depicting a surface of Arrakis; identifying at least one sandworm in the input image by processing the input image with a trained machine learning model; determining a location of the at least one sandworm in the input image; generating a three-dimensional (3D) representation of the identified at least one sandworm; extracting spice from the 3D representation of the identified at least one sandworm to generate a spice extraction result; and outputting the spice extraction result.

183.content: "That's something new," Leto said. "It could be an error on my part, Sire. There are things to suggest this Liet may be a local deity." Another man down the table cleared his throat, asked: "Is it certain they deal with the smugglers?" "A smuggler caravan left this sietch while Idaho was there, carrying a heavy load of spice. They used pack beasts and indicated they faced an eighteen-day journey." "It appears," the Duke said, "that the smugglers have redoubled their operations during this period of unrest. This deserves some careful thought.
183.title: Arrakis: Dune

Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

184.content: "No hint of this must ever reach another Great House, else the Landsraad might unite against the Imperial House and there'd be chaos." "The main point," Piter said, "is this: since House Harkonnen is being used to do the Imperial dirty work, we've gained a true advantage. It's a dangerous advantage, to be sure, but if used cautiously, will bring House Harkonnen greater wealth than that of any other House in the Imperium."

He felt a soft breeze from an air duct, saw the outlet cunningly hidden in a pattern of hangings directly ahead of him.

188.content: "Thufir, I want you to examine your own emotional involvement in this. The natural human's an animal without logic. Your projections of logic onto all affairs is unnatural, but suffered to continue for its usefulness. You're the embodiment of logic--a Mentat. Yet, your problem solutions are concepts that, in a very real sense, are projected outside yourself, there to be studied and rolled around, examined from all sides." "You think now to teach me my trade?" he asked, and he did not try to hide the disdain in his voice. "Anything outside yourself, this you can see and apply your logic to it," she said. "But it's a human trait that when we encounter personal problems, those things most deeply personal are the most difficult to bring out for our logic to scan. We tend to flounder around, blaming everything but the actual, deep-seated thing that's really chewing on us." "You're deliberately attempting to undermine my faith in my abilities as a Mentat," he rasped. "Were I to find one of our people attempting thus to sabotage any other weapon in our arsenal, I should not hesitate to denounce and destroy him." "The finest Mentats have a healthy respect for the error factor in their computations," she said.
188.title: Method and apparatus for determining a user's emotional state based on facial expressions
188.abstract: A method of determining a user's emotional state based on the user's facial expression includes receiving, by an electronic device, at least one image comprising a plurality of frames. Each frame in the plurality of frames is associated with a respective time interval. The method further includes analyzing each frame in the plurality of frames to determine whether or not there is a change between successive ones of the plurality of frames that exceeds a predetermined threshold. If it is determined that there is a change between successive ones of the plurality of frames that exceeds the predetermined threshold, the method additionally includes identifying an emotional state from among a plurality of predefined emotional states corresponding to changes between successive ones of the plurality of frames that exceed the predetermined threshold. Finally, the method also includes outputting information indicative of the identified emotional state.

189.content: "Water is the least favorable condition for life on Arrakis. And remember that growth itself can produce unfavorable conditions unless treated with extreme care." "Do you mean Arrakis can have an orderly cycle of water to sustain human life under more favorable conditions?"
189.title: Sandworms of Arrakis: genetic engineering and ecology of D
189.abstract: The sandworms of Arrakis, the spice-producing worms from Frank Herbert's classic science fiction novel Dune (1965), have fascinated biologists for decades. Here we provide an overview of what is known about these creatures, including their evolutionary history, morphology, physiology, reproduction, symbiosis with mycetophagous nematodes, parasitism by tapeworms, feeding habits, digestive enzymes, defense mechanisms, sensory organs, pheromones, migratory behavior, metabolic rate, growth rates, longevity, sexual dimorphism, sex determination, reproductive strategies, brood care, parental investment, mating systems, population dynamics, social organization, colony structure, territoriality, division of labor, cooperative breeding

"Southeast over the Shield Wall," Kynes said. "That's where I told your sandmaster to concentrate his equipment."

191.title: Method and apparatus for detecting a presence of a substance in an environment
191.abstract: A method is disclosed for detecting the presence of a substance in an environment. The method comprises receiving (102) one or more signals indicative of electromagnetic radiation received from the environment, determining (104) at least one characteristic of the signal(s), comparing (106) the at least one determined characteristic with pre-determined thresholds to determine whether said at least one characteristic satisfies each of the pre-determined thresholds, and outputting (108) an indication that the substance is present in the environment when it is determined that the at least one characteristic satisfies each of the pre-determined thresholds. An apparatus for carrying out the method is also disclosed.

192.content: He pointed. "Those poles we passed--there are more of them." She looked, following the line of his hand, saw the poles--wind-scratched markers--made out the shadow of a narrow ledge that twisted into a crevasse high above them. "They mark a way up the cliff," Paul said. He settled his shoulders into the pack, crossed to the foot of the ledge and began the climb upward. Jessica waited a moment, resting, restoring her strength; then she followed. Up they climbed, following the guide poles until the ledge dwindled to a narrow lip at the mouth of a dark crevasse.
192.title: Method and apparatus for navigating in a three-dimensional environment

The method includes receiving, by an electronic device from at least one sensor coupled to the electronic device, sensed data indicative of objects within a field of view of the at least one sensor; determining, by the electronic device using machine learning techniques applied to the sensed data received from the at least one sensor, whether there are any obstacles that may impede movement of the electronic device along a navigation path through the 3D environment; and controlling, by the electronic device responsive to it being determined that there are no obstacles that may impede movement of the electronic device along the navigation path through the 3D environment, motion of the electronic device along the navigation path through the 3D environment.

He sat upright as a discreet tapping sounded at the door in the wall behind him. Piter unfolded from his chair, crossed to the door, cracked it wide enough to accept a message cylinder. 195.content: Jessica saw how Paul, seated near his father, was studying the reactions around him. She found herself also fascinated by what her guests' actions revealed-- especially among the women. Reluctance to just discard it exposed itself in trembling hands, delayed reactions' nervous laughter . . . and violent obedience to the necessity. One woman dropped her flagon, looked the other way as her male companion recovered it.

201.abstract: A method of operating an autonomous vehicle includes detecting, by one or more sensors coupled to the autonomous vehicle, at least one object in proximity to the autonomous vehicle. Additionally, the method includes directing the wakeshot toward the at least one object so as to cause the at least one object to move out of the predetermined distance from the autonomous vehicle. 202.content: = = = = = = Many have marked the speed with which Muad'Dib learned the necessities of Arrakis. The Bene Gesserit, of course, know the basis of this speed. For the others, we can say that Muad'Dib learned rapidly because his first training was in how to learn. And the first lesson of all was the basic trust that he could learn. It is shocking to find how many people do not believe they can learn, and how many more believe learning to be difficult.
202.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for learning to learn
202.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to methods, systems, and computer-readable media for learning to learn. In one implementation, a method is performed by at least one processing device that causes the at least one processing device to receive input data associated with a first machine learning model (MLM1). The MLM1 can be trained using a second MLM2. Input data associated with the second MLM2 can be received from a third MLM3. Based on the input data associated with the first MLM1 and the input data associated with the second MLM2, an updated version of the first MLM1 can be generated. This updated version of the first MLM1 can then be used to train a fourth MLM4. Additional implementations of the present disclosure are described in greater detail herein.

204.content: "The presence of moisture in the air helps prevent too-rapid evaporation from living bodies," his father said. Why does he keep repeating the obvious? Kynes wondered. He tried to think of moisture in the air--grass covering this dune . . . open water somewhere beneath him, a long qanat flowing with water open to the sky except in text illustrations. Open water . . . irrigation water . . . it took five thousand cubic meters of water to irrigate one hectare of land per growing season, he remembered. "Our first goal on Arrakis," his father said, "is grassland provinces. We will start with these mutated poverty grasses. When we have moisture locked in grasslands, we'll move on to start upland forests, then a few open bodies of water--small at first--and situated along lines of prevailing winds with windtrap moisture precipitators spaced in the lines to recapture what the wind steals. We must create a true sirocco--a moist wind--but we will never get away from the necessity for windtraps." Always lecturing me, Kynes thought.

A voice lifted from the back of the troop: "What of the water, Stil? What of the literjons in their pack?" "I know your need, Farok," Stilgar said. He glanced at Jessica.

206.content: He turned to Hawat. "This'd be a good point to report on equipment. How many sandcrawlers, harvesters, spice factories, and supporting equipment have they left us?" "A full complement, as it says in the Imperial inventory audited by the Judge of the Change, my Lord," Hawat said. He gestured for an aide to pass him a folder, opened the folder on the table in front of him. "They neglect to mention that less than half the crawlers are operable, that only about a third have carryalls to fly them to spice sands--that everything the Harkonnens left us is ready to break down and fall apart. We'll be lucky to get half the equipment into operation and luckier yet if a fourth of it's still working six months from now." "Pretty much as we expected," Leto said. "What's the firm estimate on basic equipment?" Hawat glanced at his folder. "About nine hundred and thirty harvester-factories that can be sent out in a few days. About sixty-two hundred and fifty ornithopters for survey, scouting, and weather observation . . . carryalls, a little under a thousand." Halleck said: "Wouldn't it be cheaper to reopen negotiations with the Guild for permission to orbit a frigate as a weather satellite?"

207.content: How the mind gears itself for its environment, she thought. And she recalled a Bene Gesserit axiom: "The mind can go either direction under stress--toward positive or toward negative: on or off. Think of it as a spectrum whose extremes are unconsciousness at the negative end and hyperconsciousness at the positive end. The way the mind will lean under stress is strongly influenced by training."
207.title: Systems and methods for determining a user's emotional state based on physiological data

208.content: Paul came to his senses, feeling the sand needles sting his exposed cheeks. We are committed, he thought. He put an arm around the signalman's shoulder, said: "Leave the equipment! There's more in the tunnel." He felt himself being pulled away, Fedaykin pressed around him to protect him. They squeezed into the tunnel mouth, feeling its comparative silence, turned a corner into a small chamber with glowglobes overhead and another tunnel opening beyond. Another signalman sat there at his equipment. "Much static," the man said. A swirl of sand filled the air around them. "Seal off this tunnel!" Paul shouted.
