This mass, after exposure to sun and air, becomes melange (See also Melange and Water of Life.) PROCES VERBAL: a semiformal report alleging a crime against the Imperium. Legally: an action falling between a loose verbal allegation and a formal charge of crime. PROCTOR SUPERIOR: a Bene Gesserit Reverend Mother who is also regional director of a B.G. school. (Commonly: Bene Gesserit with the Sight.) PRUDENCE DOOR or PRUDENCE BARRIER (idiomatically: pru-door or pru-barrier): any pentashield situated for the escape of selected persons under conditions of pursuit. (See Pentashield.) PUNDI RICE: a mutated rice whose grains, high in natural sugar, achieve lengths up to four centimeters; chief export of Caladan. PYONS: planet-bound peasants or laborers, one of the base classes under the Faufreluches. Legally: wards of the planet. PYRETIC CONSCIENCE: so-called "conscience of fire"; that inhibitory level touched by Imperial conditioning. (See Imperial conditioning.) QANAT: an open canal for carrying irrigation water under controlled conditions through a desert. QIRTAIBA; see Ibn Qirtaiba. QUIZARA TAFWID: Fremen priests (after Muad'Dib).

314.content: He waited while coffee was brought in from the adjoining room and served, noting the tiredness in some of the faces. Presently, he put on his mask of quiet efficiency, stood up and commanded their attention with a knuckle rap against the table. "Well, gentlemen," he said, "our civilization appears to've fallen so deeply into the habit of invasion that we cannot even obey a simple order of the Imperium without the old ways cropping up." Dry chuckles sounded around the table, and Paul realized that his father had said the precisely correct thing in precisely the correct tone to lift the mood here. Even the hint of fatigue in his voice was right. "I think first we'd better learn if Thufir has anything to add to his report on the Fremen," the Duke said. "Thufir?" Hawat glanced up. "I've some economic matters to go into after my general report, Sire, but I can say now that the Fremen appear more and more to be the allies we need.

There was murmuring nervousness in the voices. Little cliques gathered like knots among the robes. Jessica tucked a message cylinder beneath her robe as she emerged to the ledge from Paul's private quarters.
316.title: Apparatus and method for detecting deception

317.content: The thought sent a pang of foreboding through him. He forced his attention away from Fenring, looked now at the remnants of Sardaukar men and officers, the bitterness on their faces and the desperation. Here and there among them, faces caught Paul's attention briefly: Sardaukar officers measuring the preparations within this room, planning and scheming yet for a way to turn defeat into victory.

318.content: Then the door was closed and there came a snick as Kynes threw the bolts. "I appear to've decided," Kynes said. "Someone detected your machinery before it was shut down," Paul said. He pulled his mother away from the door, met the despair in her eyes.
318.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a vehicle
318.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized access to a vehicle is disclosed. Responsive to determining that the at least one second ECU has been activated within the predetermined period of time after deactivation of the first ECU, the method further includes transmitting, by the first ECU, a notification message comprising information associated with the activation of the at least one second ECU during the predetermined period of time following deactivation of the first ECU.

319.content: Paul followed his mother's example, gestalting the room, seeing the workbench down one side, the walls of featureless rock. Instruments lined the bench--dials glowing, wire gridex planes with fluting glass emerging from them. An ozone smell permeated the place. Some of the Fremen moved on around a concealing angle in the chamber and new sounds started there--machine coughs, the whinnies of spinning belts and multidrives. Paul looked to the end of the room, saw cages with small animals in them stacked against the wall. "You've recognized this place correctly," Kynes said. "For what would you use such a place, Paul Atreides?" "To make this planet a fit place for humans," Paul said. Perhaps that's why I help them, Kynes thought. The machine sounds abruptly hummed away to silence. Into this void there came a thin animal squeak from the cages.

Other aspects and embodiments are disclosed herein.

320.content: "But his Sardaukar are sure to report it to him. Before that happens, though, I'll have my own report in his hands through CHOAM Company channels. I will explain that I luckily discovered a doctor who pretended to the conditioning. A false doctor, you understand? Since everyone knows you cannot counter the conditioning of a Suk School, this will be accepted." "Ah-h-h, I see," Rabban murmured. And the Baron thought: Indeed, I hope you do see. I hope you do see how vital it is that this remain secret. The Baron suddenly wondered at himself.

322.content: He found himself in the assembly hall through which he and his men had been led by Tuek's aides. It was a long, fairly narrow area chewed out of the native rock, its smooth surface betraying the use of cutteray burners for the job. The ceiling stretched away high enough to continue the natural supporting curve of the rock and to permit internal air-convection currents. Weapons racks and lockers lined the walls.

324.content: Presently he felt steps beneath his feet, curving down to the left. Light reflected back up across hooded heads and a winding movement of people spiraling down the steps. Jessica sensed mounting tension in the people around her, a pressure of silence that rasped her nerves with its urgency.
324.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an autonomous vehicle based on a user's emotional state detected by a head-mounted device (HMD)
324.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle includes detecting, by a head-mounted device (HMD), at least one facial feature of a user wearing the HMD. In response to determining that the at least one facial feature indicates that the user is experiencing the first emotional state, the method further includes adjusting operation of the autonomous vehicle in accordance with the first emotional state indicated by the at least one facial feature.

325.content: "What'll I be studying on the way across?" "Ah-h-h-h, the terranic life forms of Arrakis. The planet seems to have opened its arms to certain terranic life forms. It's not clear how. I must seek out the planetary ecologist when we arrive -- a Dr. Kynes -- and offer my help in the investigation." And Yueh thought: What am I saying?

326.content: He crossed to the dummy, slapped the switch on its chest with his rapier tip and felt the defensive field forcing his blade away. "En garde!" Halleck called, and the dummy pressed the attack. Paul activated his shield, parried and countered. Halleck watched as he manipulated the controls. His mind seemed to be in two parts: one alert to the needs of the training fight, and the other wandering in fly-buzz.
326.title: Systems and methods for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
326.abstract: Implementations of systems and methods for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) are disclosed. In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data from the UAV; processing the sensor data to identify at least one object within a predetermined range of the UAV; determining whether the at least one object is moving toward or away from the UAV; in response to determining that the at least one object is moving toward the UAV, causing the UAV to move closer to the at least one object; and in response to determining that the at least one object is moving away from the UAV, causing the UAV to move further away from the at least one object.

327.content: "The power to destroy a thing is the absolute control over it. You've agreed I have that power.
327.title: Apparatus and method for controlling an autonomous vehicle in response to verbal commands from a
327.abstract: A control system is provided. The control system includes one or more sensors configured to generate sensor data indicative of the environment surrounding an autonomous vehicle, at least one processor coupled to the one or more sensors, wherein the at least one processor is configured to analyze the sensor data generated by the one or more sensors to determine that a verbal command has been input into the autonomous vehicle while the autonomous vehicle is traveling along a predetermined route; and cause the autonomous vehicle to deviate from the predetermined route in response to determining that the verbal command has been input into the autonomous vehicle while the autonomous vehicle is traveling along the predetermined route.

328.content: He moved a step closer. "Did I not say to you that you were to know precisely what the na-Baron was saying at all times -- and to whom?" Another step.
328.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized communications
328.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized communication includes receiving, by a computing device, a first message from a first user account associated with the computing device. A second message is received from a second user account that is different than the first user account. An identity of the second user account is verified to determine whether the second user account is authorized to communicate with the computing device. In response to determining that the second user account is not authorized to communicate with the computing device, one or more actions are taken in response to verifying the identity of the second user account.

329.content: An unmarked ornithopter squatted nearby, humming softly on standby like a somnolent insect. An Atreides guard stood beside it with bared sword and the faint air-distortion of a shield around him. Kynes sneered at the shield pattern, thinking: Arrakis has a surprise for them there! The planetologist raised a hand, signaled for his Fremen guard to fall back. He strode on ahead toward the building's entrance--the dark hole in plastic-coated rock. So exposed, that monolithic building, he thought.
329.title: Sandworms of Dune
329.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for simulating the sandworms of Frank Herbert's Dune novels are provided. In one embodiment, a method is performed by at least one processing device in association with memory. The method includes receiving an input from a user that specifies characteristics of a sandworm to be simulated; determining whether the specified characteristics fall within predetermined parameters; if the specified characteristics do not fall within the predetermined parameters, providing feedback to the user indicating that the specified characteristics do not fall within the predetermined parameters; and if the specified characteristics do fall within the predetermined parameters, generating a simulation of the sandworm having the specified characteristics.

330.content: Gurney accepted this with only a widening of the eyes. Paul watched the action around them with a critical eye. A curry color dominated the southern sky now and there came fitful bursts and gusts of wind that whipped dust around their heads.
330.title: Apparatus and method for controlling airflow over a surface of an automotive vehicle
330.abstract: An apparatus for controlling airflow over a surface of an automotive vehicle is disclosed. The apparatus comprises at least one light emitting diode (LED) configured to emit light in response to electrical power being supplied thereto, wherein the at least one LED is positioned proximate to the surface of the automotive vehicle; and at least one sensor configured to generate a signal indicative of ambient conditions associated with the surface of the automotive vehicle. A method for controlling airflow over a surface of an automotive vehicle is also disclosed.

331.content: "Properly suited, your forehead cap tight, all seals in order, your major water loss is through the palms of your hands," Kynes said. "You can wear suit gloves if you're not using your hands for critical work, but most Fremen in the open desert rub their hands with juice from the leaves of the creosote bush. It inhibits perspiration." The Duke glanced down to the left at the broken landscape of the Shield Wall--chasms of tortured rock, patches of yellow-brown crossed by black lines of fault shattering.
331.title: Method and apparatus for cooling a heat exchanger in a refrigeration system
331.abstract: A method of cooling a heat exchanger in a refrigeration system. The method comprises the steps of: (a) determining an amount of energy that is required to melt ice within the heat exchanger; (b) determining an amount of energy that is available from a compressor associated with the refrigeration system; (c) comparing the amount of energy determined in step (a) with the amount of energy determined in step (b); and (d) if the amount of energy determined in step (a) exceeds the amount of energy determined in step (b), supplying additional energy to the heat exchanger such that the temperature of the heat exchanger is maintained at or below a predetermined temperature.

332.content: The Duke looked at Kynes, noting that the planetologist wore an old-style dark brown uniform with epaulets of the Imperial Civil Servant and a tiny gold teardrop of rank at his collar. The water-shipper asked in an angry voice: "Does the Duke imply criticism of our custom?" "This custom has been changed," Leto said. He nodded to Kynes, marked the frown on Jessica's face, thought: A frown does not become her, but it'll increase rumors of friction between us. "With the Duke's permission," the water-shipper said, "I'd like to inquire further about customs." Leto heard the sudden oily tone in the man's voice, noted the watchful silence in this group, the way heads were beginning to turn toward them around the room.
332.title: DUNE, BOOK I OF DUNE (DUNE CHRONICLES 1 OF 6)
332.abstract: A method of manufacturing an implantable medical device is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of providing a tube having a proximal end and a distal end, wherein the tube has a lumen extending from the proximal end to the distal end; positioning at least one electrode within the lumen of the tube such that the at least one electrode protrudes into the lumen of the tube; securing the at least one electrode in place within the lumen of the tube; filling the lumen of the tube with electrically conductive material so as to encapsulate the at least one electrode therein; and laser welding the proximal end of the tube to the distal end of the tube thereby hermetically sealing the cavity defined by the filled lumen of the tube around the at least one electrode.

333.content: He recognized the deaf trooper as the man who opened the 'thopter door, peered inside at the green gloom illuminated by the instrument panel. "This the 'thopter we're supposed to use?" he asked, and turned to watch his companion's lips. "It's the one the traitor said was fixed for desert work," the other said. Scarface nodded. "But it's one of them little liaison jobs.
333.title: Apparatuses, systems, and methods for liaison unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) are disclosed herein. A liaison UAV may include a fuselage, a rotor assembly coupled to
333.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is provided. The method includes determining that the UAV has transitioned from a first flight mode to a second flight mode; in response to determining that the UAV has transitioned from the first flight mode to the second flight mode, adjusting one or more propellers of the UAV such that thrust generated by the one or more propellers remains substantially constant during operation of the UAV in the second flight mode; and operating the UAV in the second flight mode while maintaining the thrust generated by the one or more propellers substantially constant. Various other methods, apparatuses, and/or systems are also disclosed.

334.content: Others released the factory's carrier wing. It detached, lifted away to fly in a parking circle low overhead. Immediately the big factory crawler lurched off, swinging away from the ridge toward the dark patch of spice out on the sand. A 'thopter swooped down nearby, skidded to a stop. Another followed and another. They disgorged Gurney's platoon and lifted to hoverflight. Gurney tested his muscles in his stillsuit, stretching. He left the filter mask off his face, losing moisture for the sake of a greater need -- the carrying power of his voice if he had to shout commands. He began climbing up into the rocks, checking the terrain -- pebbles and pea sand underfoot, the smell of spice. Good site for an emergency base, he thought. Might be sensible to bury a few supplies here. He glanced back, watching his men spread out as they followed him.
334.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing sandworms of Arrakis are disclosed herein. According to some embodiments, a method for managing sandworms of Arrakis may include receiving
334.abstract: (i) an indication that a first sandworm of Arrakis is attacking a second sandworm of Arrakis; (ii) one or more characteristics associated with the first sandworm of Arrakis; and (iii) one or more characteristics associated with the second sandworm of Arrakis. The method may further include determining whether the first sandworm of Arrakis should be allowed to continue attacking the second sandworm of Arrakis based at least in part on the one or more characteristics associated with the first sandworm of Arrakis and the one or more characteristics associated with the second sandworm of Arrakis. In response to determining that the first sandworm of Arrakis should be allowed to continue attacking the second sandworm of Arrakis, the method may include allowing the first sandworm of Arrakis to continue attacking the second sandworm of Arrakis

335.content: "What have you done to me?" he demanded. In a burst of clarity, she sensed some of the roots in the question, said: "I gave birth to you." It was, from instinct as much as her own subtle knowledge, the precisely correct answer to calm him. He felt her hands holding him, focused on the dim outline of her face. (Certain gene traces in her facial structure were noted in the new way by his onflowing mind, the clues added to other data, and a final-summation answer put forward.)
335.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and treating neurological disorders
335.abstract: A method of diagnosing Parkinson's Disease (PD) is provided. The method includes the steps of administering at least one electroencephalography (EEG) test to a patient, wherein the EEG test comprises measuring brain wave activity in response to an auditory stimulus; analyzing the measured brain wave activity from the EEG test to determine whether or not the patient suffers from PD; and determining that the patient suffers from PD upon analysis of the measured brain wave activity from the EEG test indicating that the patient suffers from PD.

336.content: I merely point out to you that someone is attacking us through the basic arrangement of our lives. It's clever, diabolical. I propose to negate this attack by so ordering our lives that there'll be no chinks for such barbs to enter."
336.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and preventing cyber-attacks
336.abstract: A system, apparatus, and computer program product are described herein. In an embodiment, the invention comprises a computing device that includes at least one processor coupled to non-transitory machine readable storage media. The at least one processor executes instructions stored on the non-transitory machine readable storage media to receive data from a plurality of sensors; analyze the data received from the plurality of sensors to identify anomalies indicative of unauthorized network activity; determine whether the identified anomalies represent malicious or authorized network activity; responsive to determining that the identified anomalies do not represent malicious network activity, ignore the identified anomalies; and responsive to determining that the identified anomalies represent malicious network activity, take corrective action to mitigate the malicious network activity represented by the identified anomalies.

337.content: Our Missionaria Protectiva seldom fails. A place was prepared for us in this wilderness. The prayer of the salat has carved out our hiding place.
337.title: Protective garment and method of manufacturing the protective garment
337.abstract: A protective garment includes a main body having a front portion, a back portion, left and right side portions extending from the front portion to the back portion, upper and lower edge portions respectively defining an upper edge portion and a lower edge portion that extend around the periphery of the main body. The protective garment further includes at least one fastening member configured to be engaged with corresponding engaging members disposed on another protective garment so as to attach the two protective garments to each other.

338.content: "Secure in the rocks below us," Paul said. "We've a cave here -- Cave of Birds. We'll decide what to do with them after the storm." A voice called from above them: "Muad'Dib!" Paul turned at the call, saw a Fremen guard motioning them down to the cave. Paul signaled he had heard. Gurney studying him with a new expression.

339.content: The Duke fed more power to the wings, stiffened them for a steeper descent as he settled lower in a circling glide above the crawler. A glance left and right showed his cover holding altitude and circling overhead. Paul studied the yellow cloud belching from the crawler's pipe vents, looked out over the desert at the approaching worm track.
339.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS)
339.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS) includes receiving, by the UAV or UAS, at least one sensor reading from each of a plurality of sensors associated with the UAV or UAS. The method also includes determining whether to control the UAV or UAS in accordance with a predetermined set of rules that are determined prior to take-off of the UAV or UAS. In response to determining not to control the UAV or UAS in accordance with the predetermined set of rules, the method further includes causing the UAV or UAS to fly according to a first flight profile. In response to determining to control the UAV or UAS in accordance with the predetermined set of rules, the method further includes causing the UAV or UAS to fly according to a second flight profile different than the

340.content: They were all caught up in the need of their race to renew its scattered inheritance, to cross and mingle and infuse their bloodlines in a great new pooling of genes. And the race knew only one sure way for this--the ancient way, the tried and certain way that rolled over everything in its path: jihad.
340.title: Method and apparatus for enhancing reproductive fitness
340.abstract: A method of enhancing the reproductive fitness of an animal, comprising administering to the animal at least one dose of a composition comprising (i) from about 0.1% to about 99% by weight water; (ii) from about 0.1% to about 25% by weight glycerol; (iii) from about 0.1% to about 30% by weight propylene glycol; (iv) from about 0.1% to about 40% by weight ethanol; (v) from about 0.1% to about 60% by weight isopropyl alcohol; (vi) from about 0.1% to about 80% by weight methanol; (vii) from about 0.1% to about 70% by weight sodium chlor

341.content: No prescient dream, no experience of his life had quite prepared him for the totality with which the veils had been ripped away to reveal naked time. Recalling the experience, he recognized his own terrible purpose--the pressure of his life spreading outward like an expanding bubble . . . time retreating before it . . . Jessica found the tent's glowtab control, activated it. Dim green light drove back the shadows, easing her fear.
341.title: Method and apparatus for providing a virtual reality environment for use in conjunction with a real-world environment
341.abstract: A method of providing a virtual reality environment for use in conjunction with a real-world environment, the method comprising: (a) capturing image data representative of at least a portion of the real-world environment; (b) processing the captured image data to identify one or more objects within the captured image data; (c) determining whether any of the identified objects are human beings; (d) if it is determined that none of the identified objects are human beings, then performing step (e), and if it is determined that at least one of the identified objects is a human being, then performing step (f); wherein steps (e) and (f) are performed concurrently.

343.content: Paul glanced down the ridge past the Fedaykin, studied the smuggler crew who had come with Halleck. "How do your men stand, Gurney?" he asked. "They're smugglers all," Gurney said. "They stand where the profit is." "Little enough profit in our venture," Paul said, and he noted the subtle finger signal flashed to him by Gurney's right hand -- the old hand code out of their past. There were men to fear and distrust in the smuggler crew. Paul pulled at his lip to indicate he understood, looked up at the men standing guard above them on the rocks. He saw Stilgar there. Memory of the unsolved problem with Stilgar cooled some of Paul's elation. "Stilgar," he said, "this is Gurney Halleck of whom you've heard me speak. My father's master-of-arms, one of the swordmasters who instructed me, an old friend.
343.title: Arrakis: Dune, Book 1 (Dune Chronicles 1 of 6)
343.abstract: A method for managing an autonomous vehicle is provided. The method includes receiving sensor data from sensors associated with the autonomous vehicle and processing the sensor data to identify one or more obstacles in proximity to the autonomous vehicle. The method further includes determining that at least one of the one or more obstacles is likely to collide with the autonomous vehicle within a predetermined amount of time. Responsive to determining that at least one of the one or more obstacles is likely to collide with the autonomous vehicle within the predetermined amount of time, the method includes controlling the autonomous vehicle such that the autonomous vehicle avoids colliding with the at least one of the one or more obstacles.

The solido-image of the harvester-factory was replaced by a projection of a winged device that dwarfed the images of human figures around it. "This is a carryall," Hawat said. "It's essentially a large 'thopter, whose sole function is to deliver a factory to spice-rich sands, then to rescue the factory when a sandworm appears.

345.content: This is a Bene Gesserit Reverend Mother, patient in a patient cause. She could wait with her sisters -- ninety generations for the proper combination of genes and environment to produce the one person their schemes required. Observe her! She knows now that the ninety generations have produced that person.

346.content: "What possible connection is there between Arrakis and Salusa Secundus?" The Baron felt the alertness in Fenring's eyes, said: "No connection yet."

346.abstract: Systems, methods, and computer-readable media are disclosed herein. An exemplary method includes receiving an indication of one or more items to be moved from a first storage location to a second storage location; determining that the item(s) will not fit in the second storage location due to at least one other item already stored in the second storage location; responsive to determining that the item(s) will not fit in the second storage location, storing the item(s) in a third storage location separate from the first storage location and the second storage location; retrieving the item(s) from the third storage location; and moving the item(s) from the third storage location to the second storage location. Other embodiments are disclosed herein.

347.content: She caught it and propped it open securely with the stick Hawat had left. Again, she faced the wheel-locked inner door, seeing now a faint inscription etched in the metal above the handle. She recognized Galach words, read: "O, Man! Here is a lovely portion of God's Creation; then, stand before it and learn to love the perfection of Thy Supreme Friend." Jessica put her weight on the wheel. It turned left and the inner door opened. A gentle draft feathered her cheek, stirred her hair. She felt change in the air, a richer taste.
347.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an autonomous vehicle
347.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle includes determining, by one or more sensors associated with the autonomous vehicle, that the autonomous vehicle is moving at a speed greater than a predetermined threshold. Responsive to determining that the autonomous vehicle is moving at the speed greater than the predetermined threshold, control circuitry associated with the autonomous vehicle controls the autonomous vehicle to decelerate from the speed greater than the predetermined threshold to a speed less than the predetermined threshold. Control circuitry associated with the autonomous vehicle further controls the autonomous vehicle to accelerate from the speed less than the predetermined threshold back to the speed greater than the predetermined threshold.

348.content: He felt the liquid gush into his throat as Chani pressed the sack, sensed giddiness in the fumes. Chani removed the spout, handed the sack into hands that reached for it from the floor of the cavern. His eyes focused on her arm, the green band of mourning there.
348.title: The Last Emperox (The Machine Dynasty Book 3)

349.content: A copper pin engraved with the likeness of a hare clasped the neck of Kynes' robe. Another smaller pin with similar likeness hung at the corner of the hood which was thrown back over his shoulders. Halleck twisted in the seat beside Paul, reached back into the rear compartment and brought out his baliset. Kynes looked around as Halleck tuned the instrument, then returned his attention to their course. "What would you like to hear, young Master?" Halleck asked. "You choose, Gurney," Paul said.
349.title: Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune: House Harkonnen (Dune
349.abstract: Systems, methods, and computer-readable media are disclosed herein. An example method may include receiving an indication of one or more sensors associated with at least one electronic device; determining whether the one or more sensors have been inactive for a predetermined amount of time; responsive to determining that the one or more sensors have been inactive for the predetermined amount of time, transmitting instructions to deactivate the one or more sensors such that the one or more sensors are no longer able to collect sensor data from their respective surroundings; detecting movement of the at least one electronic device while the one or more sensors are deactivated; and responsive to detecting the movement of the at least one electronic device, reactivating the one or more sensors so that the one or more sensors can resume collecting sensor data from their respective surroundings.

350.content: Jessica nodded, walked to the fissure's mouth where she could get a sweep of the desert, and swung her binoculars to the left. A salt pan glared white there with a blending of dirty tan at its edges--a field of white out here where white was death. But the pan said another thing: water. At some time water had flowed across that glaring white. She lowered her binoculars, adjusted her burnoose, listened for a moment to the sound of Paul's movements.
350.title: Method and apparatus for locating buried objects using ground penetrating radar (GPR)
350.abstract: A method of determining the location of an underground object is disclosed. The method includes transmitting, from a transmitter antenna mounted to a mobile platform, a first electromagnetic pulse having a predetermined frequency; receiving, at a receiver antenna mounted to the mobile platform, one or more reflections of the first electromagnetic pulse that have been scattered by the underground object; processing the one or more reflections of the first electromagnetic pulse in order to determine a position of the underground object with respect to the mobile platform; and controlling movement of the mobile platform according to the determined position of the underground object relative to the mobile platform.

351.content: Heat forced her thoughts onto water and the observed fact that this whole people could be trained to be thirsty only at given times. Thirst. She could remember moonlit waves on Caladan throwing white robes over rocks . . . and the wind heavy with dampness. Now the breeze that fingered her robes seared the patches of exposed skin at cheeks and forehead. The new nose plugs irritated her, and she found herself overly conscious of the tube that trailed down across her face into the suit, recovering her breath's moisture. The suit itself was a sweatbox. "Your suit will be more comfortable when you've adjusted to a lower wafer content in your body, " Stilgar had said. She knew he was right, but the knowledge made this moment no more comfortable. The unconscious preoccupation with water here weighed on her mind. No, she corrected herself: it was preoccupation with moisture. And that was a more subtle and profound matter. She heard approaching footsteps, turned to see Paul come out of the cave's depths trailed by the elfin-faced Chani. There's another thing, Jessica thought.
351.title: Systems and methods for providing a dune: frank herbert's dune, or, frank herbert's dune messiah are disclosed. In one embodiment, a method for providing a dune: fran
351.abstract: A wireless power transmitter may include an antenna array including a plurality of antenna elements configured to radiate electromagnetic (EM) waves from the wireless power transmitter. The wireless power transmitter may further include processing circuitry coupled to the antenna array. The processing circuitry may be configured to determine at least one parameter associated with each of the plurality of antenna elements; generate a control signal based on the at least one parameter associated with each of the plurality of antenna elements; and cause the antenna array to radiate EM waves based on the control signal.

352.content: They've been acting as guides to the Sardaukar. They report that a Fremen band ambushed a Sardaukar force somewhere southeast of here and wiped it out." "Wiped out a Sardaukar force?"
352.title: Sandworms of Arrakis, part 1 of 3: Dune, book one of the dune chronicles
352.abstract: A sandworm is disclosed. The sandworm includes a body having a first end and a second end opposite the first end; at least two tentacles protruding from the first end of the body, wherein each tentacle comprises an elongated structure extending from the first end of the body in a direction toward the second end of the body to form a shape resembling a caterpillar or snake when viewed from any angle other than perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the worm's body; and a plurality of spikes projecting outwardly from the outer surface of the elongated structure of each tentacle.

353.content: The visible note contained the code phrase every Bene Gesserit not bound by a School Injunction was required to give another Bene Gesserit when conditions demanded it: "On that path lies danger." Jessica felt the back of the note, rubbed the surface for coded dots. Nothing. The edge of the pad came under her seeking fingers. Nothing. She replaced the pad where she had found it, feeling a sense of urgency. Something in the position of the pad? she wondered. But Hawat had been over this room, doubtless had moved the pad. She looked at the leaf above the pad.
353.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for presenting a story in a foreign language
353.abstract: A method of providing content to a user is disclosed. The method includes receiving an indication that the user has selected at least one item from a plurality of items associated with a story presented in a first language different than a native language of the user. Responsive to receipt of the indication, the method further includes determining which portion of the story corresponds to the at least one item selected by the user; translating the determined portion of the story corresponding to the at least one item into the native language of the user; and presenting the translated portion of the story along with the remaining portions of the story not corresponding to the at least one item in the native language of the user. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

354.content: He looked at the Dune man. "You. Who were those men?" "Friends of one of the others," the Dune man said.

355.content: A leader, you see, is one of the things that distinguishes a mob from a people. He maintains the level of individuals. Too few individuals, and a people reverts to a mob." His words, the depth of their awareness, the fact that he spoke as much to her as to those who secretly listened, forced her to reevaluate him. He has stature, she thought.
355.title: Method and apparatus for managing a plurality of electronic devices in a networked environment
355.abstract: A method, computer program product, and computer system for managing a plurality of electronic devices in a networked environment are disclosed. 356.content: Scarface, the deaf one they called Kinet, took his place in front. The litter-bearer, the one they called Czigo, came around and took the other front seat. Kinet closed his door, bent to the controls. The 'thopter took off in a wing-tucked surge, headed south over the Shield Wall. Czigo tapped his companion's shoulder, said: "Whyn't you turn around and keep an eye on them two?"
356.title: The Shield World (The Shield World Saga, Book 1)

357.content: Jessica felt the dry pulling of skin on her cheeks and forehead relaxing in the presence of moisture. The water pool was deep; she could sense its deepness, and resisted a desire to dip her hands into it. A splashing sounded on her left. She looked down the shadowy line of Fremen, saw Stilgar with Paul standing beside him and the watermasters emptying their load into the pool through a flowmeter. The meter was a round gray eye above the pool's rim. She saw its glowing pointer move as the water flowed through it, saw the pointer stop at thirty-three liters, seven and three-thirty-seconds drachms. Superb accuracy in water measurement, Jessica thought.
357.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for sandworms of Dune (Battle of Arrakeen). In some implementations, a method includes presenting, to a user device,

When it is determined that the avatar will survive the Battle of Arrakeen, the method additionally includes causing presentation of a second virtual reality environment that simulates life after the Battle of Arrakeen as experienced by the avatar.

361.title: Systems and methods for managing carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from fossil fuel combustion
361.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for managing carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from fossil fuel combustion. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method may include identifying an amount of CO2 that will be produced as a result of combustion of hydrocarbons at a power generation facility over a period of time; determining whether there is sufficient biomass material available within a predetermined proximity of the power generation facility to absorb the identified amount of CO2; in response to determining that there is insufficient biomass material available within the predetermined proximity of the power generation facility to absorb the identified amount of CO2, initiating transportation of additional biomass material into the predetermined proximity of the power generation facility such that the additional biomass material absorbs the identified amount of CO2.

362.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle includes determining, by one or more sensors associated with the autonomous vehicle, that the autonomous vehicle is moving at a speed greater than a predetermined threshold. Responsive to determining that the autonomous vehicle is moving at the speed greater than the predetermined threshold, it is determined whether there are any pedestrians in front of the autonomous vehicle. In response to determining that there are no pedestrians in front of the autonomous vehicle, braking of the autonomous vehicle is decreased. In response to determining that there are pedestrians in front of the autonomous vehicle, braking of the autonomous vehicle is prevented from being decreased.

She returned his stare, noted the whiteless eyes, the stained eyepits, the dust-rimmed beard and mustache, the line of the catchtube curving down from his nostrils into his stillsuit.

"That it shall be given to Usul in suitable ceremony when we return to the sietch." "Leader's right," the troop intoned. Lastly, he took the crysknife handle and stood with it.

We then should be able to boost it up to twelve or fifteen per cent where it belongs." He opened his eyes. "Unless my Lord wishes to adopt Harkonnen methods." "We're working for a solid and permanent planetary base," the Duke said. "We have to keep a large percentage of the people happy--especially the Fremen." "Most especially the Fremen," Hawat agreed. "Our supremacy on Caladan," the Duke said, "depended on sea and air power. Here, we must develop something I choose to call desert power. This may include air power, but it's possible it may not. I call your attention to the lack of 'thopter shields."

367.content: But even as he focused on this thought, his new awareness denied it. = = = = = = With the Lady Jessica and Arrakis, the Bene Gesserit system of sowing implant-legends through the Missionaria Protectiva came to its full fruition. The wisdom of seeding the known universe with a prophecy pattern for the protection of B.G. personnel has long been appreciated, but never have we seen a condition-ut-extremis with more ideal mating of person and preparation. The prophetic legends had taken on Arrakis even to the extent of adopted labels (including Reverend Mother, canto and respondu, and most of the Shari-a panoplia propheticus). And it is generally accepted now that the Lady Jessica's latent abilities were grossly underestimated. -from "Analysis: The Arrakeen Crisis" by the Princess Irulan [Private circulation: B.G. file number AR-81088587] All around the Lady Jessica -- piled in corners of the Arrakeen great hall, mounded in the open spaces -- stood the packaged freight of their lives: boxes, trunks, cartons, cases -- some partly unpacked. She could hear the cargo handlers from the Guild shuttle depositing another load in the entry.

Other embodiments may be described or claimed.

378.title: Apparatus and method for controlling access to premises

Otherwise, the apparatus is configured to refrain from unlocking or enabling access to the premises by the user's mobile device. A corresponding method and computer program product are also disclosed herein.

382.title: Method and system for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
382.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. 383.content: Beside each plate on the long table stood a flagon of water. There was enough water along the table, the Duke estimated, to keep a poor Arrakeen family for more than a year. Flanking the doorway in which he stood were broad laving basins of ornate yellow and green tile. Each basin had its rack of towels. It was the custom, the housekeeper had explained, for guests as they entered to dip their hands ceremoniously into a basin, slop several cups of water onto the floor, dry their hands on a towel and fling the towel into the growing puddle at the door.

There were two of the Guild agents, one tall and fat, one short and fat, both with bland gray eyes. And among the lackeys stood one of the Emperor's daughters, the Princess Irulan, a woman they said was being trained in the deepest of the Bene Gesserit ways, destined to be a Reverend Mother. She was tall, blonde, face of chiseled beauty, green eyes that looked past and through him.

386.content: He looked north across a line of rocks, studying a distant escarpment. The faraway rock profile was like an ancient battleship of the seas outlined by stars. The long swish of it lifted on an invisible wave with syllables of boomerang antennae, funnels arcing back, a pi-shaped upthrusting at the stern. An orange glare burst above the silhouette and a line of brilliant purple cut downward toward the glare. Another line of purple! And another upthrusting orange glare! It was like an ancient naval battle, remembered shellfire, and the sight held them staring.
386.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and identifying space debris in low earth orbit (LEO) and geostationary earth orbit (GEO)
386.abstract: A method of detecting and identifying space debris in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) or Geostationary Earth Orbit (GEO) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of receiving, at an optical telescope, radiation emanating from objects in LEO or GEO; processing the received radiation to generate image data representative of the object(s); analyzing the image data to identify one or more features characteristic of space debris; comparing the identified feature(s) with pre-determined criteria indicative of space debris; and classifying the object(s) as space debris if the comparison satisfies the pre-determined criteria.

The method includes determining that the UAV has reached a predetermined altitude, wherein the predetermined altitude is less than or equal to one thousand feet above ground level (AGL). In response to determining that the UAV has reached the predetermined altitude, the method includes descending the UAV from the predetermined altitude in accordance with a predefined descent profile until the UAV reaches a landing location.

390.content: Those damnable Sardaukar! With a self-accusing bitterness, he faced the thought of the soldier-fanatics and the Imperial treachery they represented. His own Mentat assessment of the data told him how little chance he had ever to present evidence of this treachery before the High Council of the Landsraad where justice might be done.
390.title: Systems and methods for detecting anomalies in network traffic
390.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting anomalies in network traffic. In one implementation, a method includes receiving, by a computing device from a first entity, a plurality of packets associated with a connection between the first entity and a second entity; determining, by the computing device, whether each of the plurality of packets complies with a predetermined set of rules; identifying, by the computing device, an anomaly among the plurality of packets when at least one of the plurality of packets does not comply with the predetermined set of rules; and outputting, by the computing device, indication of the anomaly.

391.content: Awareness flowed into that timeless stratum where he could view time, sensing the available paths, the winds of the future . . . the winds of the past: the one-eyed vision of the past, the one-eyed vision of the present and the one-eyed vision of the future--all combined in a trinocular vision that permitted him to see time-become-space. There was danger, he felt, of overrunning himself, and he had to hold onto his awareness of the present, sensing the blurred deflection of experience, the flowing moment, the continual solidification of that-which-is into the perpetual-was. In grasping the present, he felt for the first time the massive steadiness of time's movement everywhere complicated by shifting currents, waves, surges, and countersurges, like surf against rocky cliffs. It gave him a new understanding of his prescience, and he saw the source of blind time, the source of error in it, with an immediate sensation of fear. The prescience, he realized, was an illumination that incorporated the limits of what it revealed--at once a source of accuracy and meaningful error. A kind of Heisenberg indeterminacy intervened: the expenditure of energy that revealed what he saw, changed what he saw. And what he saw was a time nexus within this cave, a boiling of possibilities focused here, wherein the most minute action--the wink of an eye, a careless word, a misplaced grain of sand--moved a gigantic lever across the known universe. He saw violence with the outcome subject to so many variables that his slightest movement created vast shiftings in the pattern. The vision made him want to freeze into immobility, but this, too, was action with its consequences. The countless consequences--lines fanned out from this cave, and along most of these consequence-lines he saw his own dead body with blood flowing from a gaping knife wound. = = = = = =
391.title: Method and apparatus for generating a three-dimensional (3D) virtual reality (VR) environment from two-dimensional (2D) images
391.abstract: A method of generating a three-dimensional (3D) virtual reality (VR) environment from two-dimensional (2D) images is provided. The method includes obtaining, by one or more processors, the 2D images; determining, by the one or more processors, at least one object in each of the 2D images; identifying, by the one or more processors, depth information associated with the at least one object in each of the 2D images; converting, by the one or more processors, the 2D images into a point cloud using the identified depth information; detecting, by the one or more processors, occluded points in the point cloud; removing, by the one or more processors, the occluded points from the point cloud to generate an unoccluded point cloud; and generating, by the one or more processors, the 3D VR environment using the unoc

392.content: Politeness and his mother's obvious awe of this old woman argued caution. Yet he felt an angry apprehension at the fear he sensed radiating from his mother.
392.title: Method, system, and computer-readable storage media for determining a user's emotional state based on a user's interaction with a graphical user interface (GUI)
392.abstract: A method of determining a user's emotional state includes receiving an input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI). The GUI comprises one or more emoticons that are selectable by the user. In response to receiving the input, it is determined whether the received input corresponds to any of the one or more emoticons. Responsive to determining that the received input does not correspond to any of the one or more emoticons, information associated with the received input is stored in a data store. Additionally, responsive to determining that the received input does correspond to at least one of the one or more emoticons, information associated with both the received input and the selected emoticons is stored in the data store. A user's emotional state is then determined based on the information stored in the data store.

393.content: Here was the unborn jihad, he knew. Here was the race consciousness that he had known once as his own terrible purpose. Here was reason enough for a Kwisatz Haderach or a Lisan al-Gaib or even the halting schemes of the Bene Gesserit. The race of humans had felt its own dormancy, sensed itself grown stale and knew now only the need to experience turmoil in which the genes would mingle and the strong new mixtures survive. All humans were alive as an unconscious single organism in this moment, experiencing a kind of sexual heat that could override any barrier.
393.title: Systems and methods for managing human health and well-being
393.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for analyzing physiological data, such as heart rate variability (HRV) data, to provide insights into an individual's emotional state. In some implementations, one or more computing devices may receive HRV data associated with an individual over a period of time. One or more processors may analyze the HRV data to identify patterns in the HRV data that are indicative of different emotional states experienced by the individual during the period of time. The one or more processors may determine whether the individual is experiencing at least one undesirable emotional state based on the analysis of the HRV data. Responsive to determining that the individual is experiencing at least one undesirable emotional state, the one or more processors may cause presentation of information via a graphical user interface indicating that the individual is experiencing the at least one undesirable emotional

394.content: Kynes spoke into the microphone: "Unlisted flight--north and east of you about three kilometers. Wormsign is on intercept course, your position, estimated contact twenty-five minutes." Another voice rumbled from the speaker: "This is Spotter Control. Sighting confirmed. Stand by for contact fix." There was a pause, then: "Contact in twenty-six minutes minus. That was a sharp estimate. Who's on that unlisted flight?
394.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
394.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a first position of the UAV in a three-dimensional space; generating, by a processor associated with the UAV, a plurality of flight trajectories from the first position to a second position within the three-dimensional space according to a predetermined set of rules; selecting, by the processor, a selected flight trajectory from the plurality of flight trajectories as a final flight trajectory towards the second position; and controlling, by the processor, movement of the UAV along the final flight trajectory such that the UAV moves from the first position to the second position.

395.content: He started to stand up. A sixth sense warned him. He flashed a hand toward the shield switch--too late. A numbing shock slammed his arm aside. He felt pain there, saw a dart protruding from the sleeve, sensed paralysis spreading from it up his arm. It took an agonizing effort to lift his head and look down the passage.
395.title: Method and apparatus for detecting intruders
395.abstract: A method of detecting an intruder is provided. The method includes obtaining, by one or more sensors, sensor data associated with at least one object within a predetermined range of the one or more sensors. The method further includes processing the sensor data to generate feature vectors corresponding to the at least one object. The method also includes determining whether any of the feature vectors corresponds to a previously-detected feature vector stored in a database. In response to determining that none of the feature vectors corresponds to any of the previously-detected feature vectors, the method includes identifying the at least one object as an intruder.

396.content: The aircraft became a long, horizontal whisper of darkness lighted only by the green luminosity of the instrument panel. Through Jessica's mind flashed all the warnings about such storms--that they cut metal like butter, etched flesh to bone and ate away the bones. She felt the buffeting of dust-blanketed wind. It twisted them as Paul fought the controls. She saw him chop the power, felt the ship buck. The metal around them hissed and trembled.

398.content: He heard his mother and Yueh talking in the other room. Their words were indistinct--something about the spice . . . the Harkonnens. The conversation rose and fell. Paul's attention went to the carved headboard of his bed--a false headboard attached to the wall and concealing the controls for this room's functions. A leaping fish had been shaped on the wood with thick brown waves beneath it. He knew if he pushed the fish's one visible eye that would turn on the room's suspensor lamps. One of the waves, when twisted, controlled ventilation. Another changed the temperature.
398.title: Method and apparatus for controlling environmental conditions in an enclosed space
398.abstract: A method of controlling environmental conditions in an enclosed space is provided. The method comprises detecting at least one parameter associated with the enclosed space; determining whether the at least one parameter satisfies a predetermined criterion; if the at least one parameter satisfies the predetermined criterion, transmitting a control signal to a heating or cooling system configured to heat or cool air within the enclosed space; receiving feedback from the heating or cooling system relating to operation of the heating or cooling system; comparing the feedback received from the heating or cooling system with pre-determined thresholds; and adjusting operational parameters of the heating or cooling system responsive to comparison of the feedback with the pre-determined thresholds. An apparatus for controlling environmental conditions in an enclosed space is also provided.

400.content: They moved in a moonlit bowl punctured by that hollowed thumping. Down and up through spilling dunes: step . . .drag . . . wait . . . step . . . Across pea sand that rolled under their feet: drag . . . wait . . . step . . . And all the while their ears searched for a special hissing. The sound, when it came, started so low that their own dragging passage masked it. But it grew . . . louder and louder . . . out of the west. "Lump . . . lump . . . lump . . . lump . . . " drummed the thumper. The hissing approach spread across the night behind them. They turned their heads as they walked, saw the mound of the coursing worm.
400.title: Method and apparatus for harvesting earthworms
400.abstract: A method of harvesting earthworms includes providing an enclosure having at least one opening, the enclosure configured to retain earthworms within the enclosure. The method also includes closing the at least one opening in the enclosure with a removable barrier such that the earthworms are prevented from exiting the enclosure through the at least one opening. The method further includes removing the removable barrier so that the earthworms can exit the enclosure through the at least one opening. In addition, the method includes capturing the earthworms as they exit the enclosure through the at least one opening. An apparatus for harvesting earthworms is also disclosed.

401.content: But a man behind them said: "Plenty of moisture in the trap tonight. Jamis' way of telling us he's satisfied." Jessica passed through the secret door, heard it close behind. She saw how the Fremen slowed while passing the honeycomb lattice, felt the dampness of the air as she came opposite it. Windtrap! she thought. They've a concealed windtrap somewhere on the surface to funnel air down here into cooler regions and precipitate the moisture from it. They passed through another rock door with latticework above it, and the door closed behind them. The draft of air at their backs carried a sensation of moisture clearly perceptible to both Jessica and Paul.

402.content: "What did the men report?" "Our pet Sardaukar have been released near Old Gap low on the rim and are on their way to their master. The rocket launchers and other projectile weapons are in place. The people are deployed as you ordered. It was all routine." Paul glanced across the shallow bowl, studying his men in the filtered light admitted by the camouflage cover. He felt time creeping like an insect working its way across an exposed rock.
402.title: Dune, or The Dune Saga 1 of 6, a series of science fiction novels written by Frank Herbert and published between 1965 and 1985

Kynes fastened his harness, focused on the padded comfort of the aircraft-- soft luxury of gray-green upholstery, gleaming instruments, the sensation of filtered and washed air in his lungs as doors slammed and vent fans whirred alive.

A kit for constructing a Dune: House Harkonnen is also dis

407.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an autonomous vehicle in a hostile environment
407.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle includes determining that the autonomous vehicle is operating in a hostile environment, wherein the hostile environment comprises one or more hazards. The method also includes receiving sensor data from sensors associated with the autonomous vehicle; processing the sensor data to identify at least one hazard within a predetermined distance of the autonomous vehicle; generating a warning signal indicative of identification of the at least one hazard; and transmitting the warning signal via a wireless communication link between the autonomous vehicle and a remote device.

408.content: Already, I feel myself being tied to bits of you. Ah-h-h, you've a mind filled with interesting things. So many things I'd never imagined." 410.title: Method and apparatus for treating a patient's body tissue with a therapeutic substance
410.abstract: A method of treating a patient's body tissue includes positioning a catheter in the patient's vasculature. The catheter includes an elongate shaft having a proximal end, a distal end, and a lumen extending from the proximal end to the distal end. An expandable member is disposed at the distal end of the elongate shaft within the lumen. At least one drug reservoir is coupled to the expandable member such that the at least one drug reservoir is releasably coupled to the expandable member by the elongate shaft.

411.content: In the distance, the purple finger of a lasgun beam flicked from one of the diving 'thopters. It laced across the sand, raising a sharp trail of dust. "The cowards!" the Fremen beside Hawat rasped. The troop carrier settled toward the patch of blue-clad bodies. Its wings crept out to full reach, began the cupping action of a quick stop. Hawat's attention was caught by a flash of sun on metal to the south, a 'thopter plummeting there in a power dive, wings folded flat against its sides, its jets a golden flare against the dark silvered gray of the sky. It plunged like an arrow toward the troop carrier which was unshielded because of the lasgun activity around it. Straight into the carrier the diving 'thopter plunged. A flaming roar shook the basin.
411.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
411.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a current position of the UAV; receiving, by a processor associated with the UAV, data indicative of a plurality of obstacles in proximity to the current position of the UAV; identifying, by the processor, a first obstacle from the plurality of obstacles as being closest to the current position of the UAV; calculating, by the processor, a distance between the first obstacle and the current position of the UAV; comparing, by the processor, the calculated distance against a predetermined threshold value; and altering, by the processor, a flight path of the UAV when the calculated distance exceeds the predetermined threshold value.

412.content: The old Baron had decreed a meridian-to-meridian rest from labors, and effort had been spent in the family city of Harko to create the illusion of gaiety: banners flew from buildings, new paint had been splashed on the walls along Court Way. But off the main way, Count Fenring and his lady noted the rubbish heaps, the scabrous brown walls reflected in the dark puddles of the streets, and the furtive scurrying of the people. In the Baron's blue-walled keep, there was fearful perfection, but the Count and his lady saw the price being paid--guards everywhere and weapons with that special sheen that told a trained eye they were in regular use. There were checkpoints for routine passage from area to area even within the keep. The servants revealed their military training in the way they walked, in the set of their shoulders . . . in the way their eyes watched and watched and watched. "The pressure's on," the Count hummed to his lady in their secret language. "The Baron is just beginning to see the price he really paid to rid himself of the Duke Leto."
412.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for adaptation of Frank Herbert's Dune. In some implementations, a method includes: obtaining a plurality of episodes of a television series based on

Based on the received user feedback, further modifying the modified version of the selected episode to generate a second modified version of the selected episode. The method also includes transmitting the second modified version of the selected episode to the STB such that the second modified version of the selected episode is presented in conjunction with subsequent episodes of the plurality of

413.content: A ring formed within the troop. More glowglobes were brought and all of them tuned to the yellow band. Jamis stepped into the ring, slipped out of his robe and tossed it to someone in the crowd. He stood there in a cloudy gray slickness of stillsuit that was patched and marked by tucks and gathers. For a moment, he bent with his mouth to his shoulder, drinking from a catchpocket tube. Presently he straightened, peeled off and detached the suit, handed it carefully into the crowd. He stood waiting, clad in loincloth and some tight fabric over his feet, a crysknife in his right hand. Jessica saw the girl-child Chani helping Paul, saw her press a crysknife handle into his palm, saw him heft it, testing the weight and balance. And it came to Jessica that Paul had been trained in prana and bindu, the nerve and the fiber--that he had been taught fighting in a deadly school, his teachers men like Duncan Idaho and Gurney Halleck, men who were legends in their own lifetimes. The boy knew the devious ways of the Bene Gesserit and he looked supple and confident.

Also provided are nucleic acids encoding such polypeptides and cells expressing such polypeptides.

414.content: "Well, assignment of rooms: make certain, I have large office space next my sleeping quarters. There'll be more paper work here than on Caladan. A guard room, of course. That should cover it.
414.title: Method and apparatus for controlling environmental conditions in a habitable environment of a spacecraft
414.abstract: A method is provided for controlling environmental conditions in a habitable environment of a spacecraft. The method comprises the steps of determining (102) an atmospheric pressure within the habitable environment, comparing (104) the determined atmospheric pressure with one or more predetermined thresholds, wherein at least one of the predetermined thresholds corresponds to a maximum permissible atmospheric pressure; activating (106) a ventilation system when the determined atmospheric pressure exceeds any of the predetermined thresholds; and deactivating (108) the ventilation system when the determined atmospheric pressure does not exceed any of the predetermined thresholds. An apparatus for controlling environmental conditions in a habitable environment of a spacecraft is also provided.

415.content: He joined her in the ornithopter, still wrestling with the thought that this was blind ground, unseen in any prescient vision. And he realized with an abrupt sense of shock that he had been giving more and more reliance to prescient memory and it had weakened him for this particular emergency. "If you rely only on your eyes, your other senses weaken." It was a Bene Gesserit axiom.

Described herein are the plot, characters, themes, locales and other literary devices employed by the author to tell the story of Dune: House Atreides (Dune: House Atreides Book 1).

416.content: Presently, Leto took a leisurely diagonal course across to the lift, acknowledging salutes with a casual hand wave. He recognized a propaganda corpsman, stopped to give him a message that could be relayed to the men through channels: those who had brought their women would want to know the women were safe and where they could be found. The others would wish to know that the population here appeared to boast more women than men. The Duke slapped the propaganda man on the arm, a signal that the message had top priority to be put out immediately, then continued across the room. He nodded to the men, smiled, traded pleasantries with a subaltern. Command must always look confident, he thought.
416.title: Chapel hill lord of the rings
416.abstract: A method for preparing an oligonucleotide library is provided. The method includes providing a plurality of double-stranded DNA (dsDNA) molecules, wherein each dsDNA molecule comprises a first strand and a second strand complementary to the first strand; contacting the plurality of dsDNA molecules with a phosphoramidite reagent under conditions effective to react the phosphoramidite reagent with one or more internucleotide linkages in at least one of the first strand or the second strand to form a modified dsDNA molecule; separating unreacted phosphoramidite reagents from the modified dsDNA molecule; and repeating the contacting, separating, and separating steps until all of the plurality of dsDNA molecules are modified.

417.content: Prescience had fed his knowledge with countless experiences, hinted at the strongest currents of the future and the strings of decision that guided them, but this was the real-now. This was death hanging on an infinite number of miniscule mischances. Anything could tip the future here, he realized. Someone coughing in the troop of watchers, a distraction. A variation in a glowglobe's brilliance, a deceptive shadow.
417.title: Method and apparatus for detecting anomalies in time-series data
417.abstract: A method of detecting anomalies in time-series data is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (i) determining a plurality of cluster centroids, each corresponding to a respective one of a plurality of clusters; (ii) identifying at least one new cluster from the plurality of clusters that does not correspond to any of the plurality of cluster centroids; (iii) generating an anomaly score for the at least one new cluster by calculating a distance between the at least one new cluster and each of the plurality of cluster centroids; and (iv) adding the at least one new cluster to the plurality of clusters if the anomaly score exceeds a predetermined threshold.

MISH-MISH: apricots. MISR: the historical Zensunni(Fremen) term for themselves: "The People." MISSIONARIA PROTECTIVA: the arm of the Bene Gesserit order charged with sowing infectious superstitions on primitive worlds, thus opening those regions to exploitation by the Bene Gesserit. (See Panoplia propheticus.) MONITOR: a ten-section space warcraft mounting heavy armor and shield protection. It is designed to be separated into its component sections for lift-off after planet-fall. MUAD'DIB: the adapted kangaroo mouse of Arrakis, a creature associated in the Fremen earth-spirit mythology with a design visible on the planet's second moon. This creature is admired by Fremen for its ability to survive in the open desert. MUDIR NAHYA: the Fremen name for Beast Rabban (Count Rabban of Lankiveil), the Harkonnen cousin who was siridar governor on Arrakis for many years.
418.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and mitigating cybersecurity threats
418.abstract: A method of detecting malicious activity in a network includes receiving, by a computing device from a plurality of devices coupled to the network, data packets transmitted over the network; determining, by the computing device, one or more characteristics of the received data packets; comparing, by the computing device, the determined one or more characteristics of the received data packets against at least one set of pre-determined rules stored in memory associated with the computing device; classifying, by the computing device, the received data packets as malicious or non-malicious based on the results of the comparison between the determined one or more characteristics of the received data packets and the at least one set of pre-determined rules; and generating, by the computing device, an alert indicating whether the received data packets are malicious or non-malicious. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

424.content: He slowed his pace, staring in at a room crowded with children sitting cross-legged on a maroon-carpeted floor. At a chalkboard against the far wall stood a woman in a yellow wraparound, a projecto-stylus in one hand. The board was filled with designs--circles, wedges and curves, snake tracks and squares, flowing arcs split by parallel lines. The woman pointed to the designs one after the other as fast as she could move the stylus, and the children chanted in rhythm with her moving hand. Paul listened, hearing the voices grow dimmer behind as he moved deeper into the sietch with Harah.

The method further includes detecting that the user has moved his/her head relative to the HMD within a predetermined period of time. In response to detecting that the user has moved his/her head relative to the HMD within the predetermined period of time, the method includes determining whether movement of the user's head exceeds a predefined threshold over the predetermined period of time. If it is determined that the movement of the user's head exceeds the predefined threshold over the predetermined period of time, the method includes

425.abstract: A method of controlling atmospheric conditions at the surface of an arid planet is disclosed. The method comprises receiving data from one or more sensors, wherein the sensor(s) are positioned in space and configured to collect data relating to meteorological conditions at the surface of the arid planet; analyzing the data received from the sensor(s) to determine whether there is a need to adjust the atmospheric conditions at the surface of the arid planet; if it is determined that there is a need to adjust the atmospheric conditions at the surface of the arid planet, then releasing gases into the atmosphere above the surface of the arid planet so as to modify the atmospheric conditions at the surface of the arid planet; and transmitting information regarding the modification of the atmospheric conditions at the surface of the arid planet back to Earth.

426.title: Sandworms of Dune: a novel based on the unpublished manuscripts of Frank Herbert's Dune 3: the making of Dune
426.abstract: The Sandworms of Dune: A Novel Based on the Unpublished Manuscripts of Frank Herbert's Dune 3: The Making of DuneFrank Herbert's epic science fiction masterpiece, Dune, is widely regarded as one of the most important and influential novels ever written. It has been translated into more than 20 languages, sold more than 12 million copies worldwide, and has been made into two major motion pictures by David Lynch (with a sequel in production that will star Zendaya). Now, for the first time, Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson are telling the never-before-told story of what happened between Dune and Dune Messiah, the story of how Paul Atreides, the man who became Muad'Dib, established himself as the ruler of the known universe and began to implement his ambitious plans to create a better world

Heir to a power that will make him one of the most powerful men in the known universe, Paul must leave his home planet to fulfill a prophecy he doesn't entirely understand. What he learns on the way will change him in ways he could never have imagined . . . Hunters of Dune is the long-awaited sequel to Frank Herbert's Children of Dune--a science fiction epic written between 1982 and 1985 and left for publication at the author's death in 1986. "The Baron will want to see you soon," another said.

429.content: Paul's mind had gone on in its chilling precision. He saw the avenues ahead of them on this hostile planet. Without even the safety valve of dreaming, he focused his prescient awareness, seeing it as a computation of most probable futures, but with something more, an edge of mystery--as though his mind dipped into some timeless stratum and sampled the winds of the future. Abruptly, as though he had found a necessary key, Paul's mind climbed another notch in awareness. He felt himself clinging to this new level, clutching at a precarious hold and peering about. It was as though he existed within a globe with avenues radiating away in all directions . . . yet this only approximated the sensation. He remembered once seeing a gauze kerchief blowing in the wind and now he sensed the future as though it twisted across some surface as undulant and impermanent as that of the windblown kerchief. He saw people. He felt the heat and cold of uncounted probabilities. He knew names and places, experienced emotions without number, reviewed data of innumerable unexplored crannies.
429.title: Method and apparatus for enhancing human cognition
429.abstract: A method of enhancing human cognition is provided. The method comprises the steps of (i) presenting an image to a subject's visual field, wherein the image includes at least one object; (ii) detecting eye movements of the subject in response to presentation of the image; (iii) determining whether the detected eye movements are within a predetermined time period relative to presentation of the image; and (iv) if the detected eye movements are determined not to be within the predetermined time period, providing feedback to the subject instructing him or her to slow down his or her eye movements when viewing the image.

And you will see that the antidote becomes a regular part of Hawat's diet from this point on . . . unless I say otherwise." "The antidote, yes."

431.content: Paul crept farther into the ring, relying on his own edge in speed. Jamis backed now that the realization swept over him--that this was no soft offworlder in the tahaddi ring, easy prey for a Fremen crysknife. Jessica saw the shadow of desperation in the man's face.
