432.content: She knew she was trying to keep her thoughts off her son and the dangers he faced -- the pit traps with their poisoned barbs, the Harkonnen raids (although these were growing fewer as the Fremen took their toll of aircraft and raiders with the new weapons Paul had given them), and the natural dangers of the desert -- makers and thirst and dust chasms. She thought of calling for coffee and with the thought came that ever-present awareness of paradox in the Fremen way of life: how well they lived in these sietch caverns compared to the graben pyons; yet, how much more they endured in the open hajr of the desert than anything the Harkonnen bondsmen endured. A dark hand inserted itself through the hangings beside her, deposited a cup upon the table and withdrew. From the cup arose the aroma of spiced coffee. An offering from the birth celebration, Jessica thought.

Silently, he moved toward the grey blob, saw that it was a human figure, a man face down on the stone. Leto turned him over with a foot, knife poised, bent close in the dim light to see the face. It was the smuggler, Tuek, a wet stain down his chest.

"This planet has much oxygen without its usual concomitants--widespread plant life and large sources of free carbon dioxide from such phenomena as volcanoes. There are unusual chemical interchanges over large surf ace areas here." "Do you have pilot projects?" the Duke asked. "We've had a long time in which to build up the Tansley Effect--small-unit experiments on an amateur basis from which my science may now draw its working facts." Kynes said. "There isn't enough water," Bewt said.

Jessica moved to a position below him, called out: "May I help?"

"What would it take to set up the self-sustaining system, Doctor Kynes?" Leto asked. "If we can get three per cent of the green plant element on Arrakis involved in forming carbon compounds as foodstuffs, we've started the cyclic system," Kynes said.

438.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining a location of a vehicle in a parking facility
438.abstract: A method includes receiving sensor data from one or more sensors associated with an autonomous vehicle (AV), wherein the AV is located within a parking facility. The method further includes processing the sensor data to determine that the AV is parked at a parking space corresponding to a parking spot identifier included in the sensor data. Additionally, the method includes transmitting information identifying the parking space to which the AV is parked via a communications network. Further, the method includes detecting movement of the AV away from the parking space; and responsive to detecting the movement of the AV away from the parking space, causing the AV to return to the parking space. In some embodiments, returning the AV to the parking space causes the AV to drive itself back to the parking space.

439.content: A voice called out from the ridgetop above them: "Ho, there -- the wind!" Gurney saw a quickening of motion among the Fremen now -- a rushing about and sense of hurry. A thing the worm had not ignited was brought about by fear of the wind. The factory crawler lumbered up onto the dry beach below them and a way was opened for it among the rocks . . . and the rocks closed behind it so neatly that the passage escaped his eyes. "Have you many such hiding places?" Gurney asked.

"A human can override any nerve in the body."

The method further includes transmitting, by the one or more processors of the autonomous vehicle, the data indicative of the driving instructions to a user interface of the autonomous vehicle.

441.abstract: An apparatus is provided. The operations include obtaining sensor data from at least one sensor associated with an aircraft during a descent of the aircraft toward a runway; generating a first three-dimensional (3D) model of the aircraft using the sensor data; determining whether there are any obstacles within a predetermined distance of the aircraft based on the first 3D model; in response to determining that there are no obstacles within the predetermined distance of the aircraft, controlling flight control surfaces of the aircraft to land the aircraft on the runway; and causing display of a second 3D model having fewer details than the first 3D model on a display device.

442.content: He realized she had done this to taunt him subtly, a reproof against his recent pose of coldness. She was well aware that he liked her best in these shades--that he saw her as a rustling of warm colors. Nearby, more an outflanker than a member of the group , stood Duncan Idaho in glittering dress uniform, flat face unreadable, the curling black hair neatly combed. He had been summoned back from the Fremen and had his orders from Hawat- -"Under pretext of guarding her, you will keep the Lady Jessica under constant surveillance." The Duke glanced around the room. There was Paul in the corner surrounded by a fawning group of the younger Arrakeen richece, and, aloof among them, three officers of the House Troop. The Duke took particular note of the young women.

443.title: Method and apparatus for playing a card game
443.abstract: A method of playing a card game is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) providing a plurality of decks of cards, wherein each deck includes at least one wild card; (b) shuffling the plurality of decks to form a first set of cards; (c) removing from the first set of cards those cards that are not eligible in accordance with predetermined criteria; (d) forming a second set of cards from the first set of cards after step (c); (e) placing the second set of cards face-down as a discard pile; (f) allowing players to take turns picking up individual cards from the discard pile until there are no more cards left in the discard pile; and (g) repeating steps (a)-(f).

His plan is a good one.

Responsive to determining that each image in the plurality of images satisfies the predetermined quality criterion, the method also includes generating a three-dimensional (3D) point cloud using the plurality of images satisfying the predetermined quality criterion. 445.title: Method and apparatus for rendering an avatar of a user in a virtual reality environment
445.abstract: A method is provided for rendering an avatar of a user in a virtual reality (VR) environment. The method comprises the steps of determining, by a VR device associated with the user, one or more gestures performed by the user; receiving, by the VR device, input data corresponding to the one or more gestures determined by the VR device; transmitting, by the VR device, the input data to at least one computing device connected to the VR device over a network; generating, by the at least one computing device using the input data received from the VR device, a three-dimensional (3D) model of the user's avatar; and displaying, by the VR device, the 3D model of the user's avatar generated by the at least one computing device within the VR environment.

446.content: Again, the bird chirruped. A stir passed through the troop's ranks. And again, the mouse-thumping pecked its way across the sand. Once more, the bird chirruped. The troop resumed its climb up into a crack in the rocks, but there was a stillness of breath about the Fremen now that filled Paul with caution, and he noted covert glances toward Chani, the way she seemed to withdraw, pulling in upon herself. There was rock underfoot now, a faint gray swishing of robes around them, and Paul sensed a relaxing of discipline, but still that quiet-of-the-person about Chani and the others. He followed a shadow shape--up steps, a turn, more steps, into a tunnel, past two moisture-sealed doors and into a globelighted narrow passage with yellow rock walls and ceiling. All around him, Paul saw the Fremen throwing back their hoods, removing nose plugs, breathing deeply. Someone sighed.

447.title: Dune Messiah: A Novel Based on the Book by Frank Herbert
447.abstract: A novel entitled Dune Messiah, written by Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson is disclosed.

448.content: He reached beneath his robes, brought out a small cage, lifted a creature from it. Hawat recognized a tiny bat. The bat turned its head and Hawat saw its blue-within-blue eyes. The Fremen stroked the bat, soothing it, crooning to it. He bent over the animal's head, allowed a drop of saliva to fall from his tongue into the bat's upturned mouth.
448.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
448.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a current position of the UAV relative to a target location; receiving, by a processor associated with the UAV, control signals from a ground-based controller in response to the determined current position of the UAV relative to the target location; adjusting, responsive to the received control signals, flight characteristics of the UAV so as to cause the UAV to move towards the target location; detecting, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, that the UAV has come within a predetermined distance of the target location; and ceasing further movement of the UAV toward the target location when the UAV comes within the predetermined distance of the target location.

449.content: Memory returned to him of his wrestling with his inner awareness during the night. He saw a strange parallel here -- if he mastered the maker, his rule was strengthened; if he mastered the inward eye, this carried its own measure of command. But beyond them both lay the clouded area, the Great Unrest where all the universe seemed embroiled. The differences in the ways he comprehended the universe haunted him -- accuracy matched with inaccuracy. He saw it in situ. Yet, when it was born, when it came into the pressures of reality, the now had its own life and grew with its own subtle differences. Terrible purpose remained. Race consciousness remained. And over all loomed the jihad, bloody and wild. Chani joined him outside the tent, hugging her elbows, looking up at him from the corners of her eyes the way she did when she studied his mood. "Tell me again about the waters of thy birthworld, Usul," she said. He saw that she was trying to distract him, ease his mind of tensions before the deadly test.
449.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) using a virtual reality (VR) head-mounted display (HMD)
449.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) using a virtual reality (VR) head-mounted display (HMD) is provided. The method includes displaying, via the VR HMD, a three-dimensional (3D) model of at least a portion of an environment in which the UAV is to be flown; acquiring sensor data from one or more sensors associated with the UAV; processing the sensor data to generate control information that controls flight of the UAV within the displayed 3D model of the environment; transmitting the control information to the UAV; and flying the UAV according to the control information.

450.content: Communications men hurried into the room with their equipment, began setting up near the massive fireplace. The Fremen guard that augmented the surviving Fedaykin took up stations around the room. There was muttering among them, much darting of suspicious glances.
450.title: Dune: House Atreides (Dune: House Atreides Book 1): Dune: House Atreides (Dune: House Atreides Book 1)
450.abstract: A method of treating an eye disorder in a subject comprises administering to the subject at least one ophthalmic dose of C5aR antagonist. In some embodiments, the method further comprises administering to the subject at least one systemic dose of C5aR antagonist and/or administering to the subject at least one intravitreal dose of C5aR antagonist.

451.content: Paul fed more power to the jetpods. The 'thopter banked, sinking them into their seats as a dark wall lifted against the stars ahead. He gave the craft more wing, more power. Another burst of lifting wingbeats and they came out over rocks, silver-frosted angles and outcroppings in the starlight. The dust-reddened second moon showed itself above the horizon to their right, defining the ribbon trail of the storm. Paul's hands danced over the controls.
451.title: Apparatuses, systems, methods, and computer-readable media are disclosed herein. An example apparatus includes a processor and a memory. The processor is configured to execute code stored in the memory. The code, when executed by
451.abstract: the processor, causes display of a graphical user interface (GUI). The GUI comprises a plurality of selectable options for controlling operation of an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), wherein each selectable option corresponds to at least one sensor associated with the UAV. The code, when executed by the processor, further causes determination that a first selectable option has been selected from the plurality of selectable options. In response to determining that the first selectable option has been selected, the code, when executed by the processor, causes execution of instructions corresponding to the first selectable option.

452.content: "Men and their works have been a disease on the surface of their planets before now," his father said. "Nature tends to compensate for diseases, to remove or encapsulate them, to incorporate them into the system in her own way." The hawk lowered its head, stretched its wings, refolded them. It transferred its attention to his outstretched hand.
452.title: Apparatus and method for securing an object to a surface
452.abstract: An apparatus for securing an object to a surface, the apparatus comprising at least one elongate member having a first end and a second end opposite the first end, wherein the first end of the at least one elongate member is configured to engage with the object. The apparatus further comprises at least one locking mechanism positioned between the first end and the second end of the at least one elongate member, wherein the at least one locking mechanism is configured to prevent movement of the at least one elongate member relative to the surface when the first end of the at least one elongate member is engaged with the object.

453.content: The ship bucked as its tail pods whispered to silence. Stub wings elongated, cupped the air. The craft became a full 'thopter as the Duke banked it, holding the wings to a gentle beat, pointing with his left hand off to the east beyond the factory crawler. "Is that wormsign?"
453.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
453.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a current position of the UAV relative to a target location; receiving, by a processor associated with the UAV, control signals from a ground-based controller in response to the determined current position of the UAV relative to the target location; calculating, by the processor, a flight path between the current position of the UAV and the target location responsive to the received control signals; generating, by the processor, a plurality of waypoints along the calculated flight path; transmitting, by the processor, information relating to the generated plurality of waypoints to the ground-based controller; and executing, by propulsion systems associated with the UAV, manoeuvres corresponding to the plurality of waypoints such that the UAV

454.content: "Is there no alternative?" "Alternative? A Bene Gesserit should ask that?" "I ask only what you see in the future with your superior abilities." "I see in the future what I've seen in the past. You well know the pattern of our affairs, Jessica. The race knows its own mortality and fears stagnation of its heredity. It's in the bloodstream -- the urge to mingle genetic strains without plan. The Imperium, the CHOAM Company, all the Great Houses, they are but bits of flotsam in the path of the flood."
454.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for adaptation of Frank Herbert's Dune. In some implementations, a method includes: obtaining a plurality of episodes of a television series based on
454.abstract: a novel by Frank Herbert; determining one or more user preferences associated with at least one episode of the plurality of episodes; selecting an episode from the plurality of episodes based on the one or more user preferences; modifying the selected episode to generate a modified episode that is different than the selected episode; and presenting the modified episode in response to selection of the modified episode.

455.content: Kinet swiveled his seat. Jessica saw the glint of starlight on a lasgun in his hand. The 'thopter's light-walled interior seemed to collect illumination as her eyes adjusted, but the guard's scarred face remained dim. Jessica tested her seat belt, found it loose. She felt roughness in the strap against her left arm, realized the strap had been almost severed, would snap at a sudden jerk. Has someone been at this 'thopter, preparing it for us? she wondered. Who?
455.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS)
455.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, using at least one sensor associated with the UAV/UAS, whether there is any obstacle within a predetermined distance from the UAV/UAS; in response to determining that there is no obstacle within the predetermined distance from the UAV/UAS, causing the UAV/UAS to perform a pre-determined flight manoeuvre towards a target location; wherein the step of performing the pre-determined flight manoeuvre causes the UAV/UAS to change its current altitude above ground level (AGL).

456.content: -from "A Child's History of Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan As Paul fought the 'thopter's controls, he grew aware that he was sorting out the interwoven storm forces, his more than Mentat awareness computing on the basis of fractional minutiae. He felt dust fronts, billowings, mixings of turbulence, an occasional vortex. The cabin interior was an angry box lighted by the green radiance of instrument dials. The tan flow of dust outside appeared featureless, but his inner sense began to see through the curtain. I must find the right vortex, he thought. For a long time now he had sensed the storm's power diminishing, but still it shook them. He waited out another turbulence.
456.title: Apparatus and method for controlling a sandworm
456.abstract: A control system is disclosed. The control system includes a plurality of sensors configured to provide sensor data indicative of one or more operating parameters associated with an apparatus, such as a sandworm. The control system also includes at least one processor in communication with the plurality of sensors. The at least one processor is configured to receive the sensor data from the plurality of sensors; analyze the sensor data to determine whether there has been a change in the one or more operating parameters that exceeds a predetermined threshold value; and responsive to determining that there has been a change in the one or more operating parameters that exceeds the predetermined threshold value, adjusting operation of the apparatus according to the determined change in the one or more operating parameters. Various other systems, methods, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

457.content: He'll be along later." "I've been studying about the storms on Arrakis." "The storms. I see."
457.title: Sandworms of Dune
457.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for generating sandworms of Dune are provided. The method may include receiving an input from a user to generate a sandworm according to one or more attributes associated with the sandworm. The method may further include determining that the generated sandworm is not included in a plurality of sandworms stored in a database. The method may further include storing the generated sandworm in the database as part of the plurality of sandworms. In some embodiments, the method may also include presenting the generated sandworm to the user via a graphical user interface (GUI).

458.content: "They're sending a new flag up on the tall ship," the watcher said. "The flag is yellow . . . with a black and red circle in the center." "There's a subtle piece of business," Paul said. "The CHOAM Company flag."
458.title: Song of ice and fire (game of thrones)
458.abstract: A system for managing data associated with the Game of Thrones franchise is disclosed. The system may include one or more computing devices configured to receive, from a user device, an indication of interest in participating in at least one activity related to the Game of Thrones franchise. In response to receipt of the indication of interest, the one or more computing devices may be further configured to determine that the user has not previously participated in any other activities relating to the Game of Thrones franchise. Based on determining that the user has not previously participated in any other activities relating to the Game of Thrones franchise, the one or more computing devices may be further configured to provide access to the at least one activity via the user device.

459.content: Leto sensed memories rolling in his mind--the old toothless mutterings of hags. The room, the table, the Baron, a pair of terrified eyes--blue within blue, the eyes--all compressed around him in ruined symmetry. There was a man with a boot-toe chin, a toy man falling. The toy man had a broken nose slanted to the left: an offbeat metronome caught forever at the start of an upward stroke. Leto heard the crash of crockery--so distant--a roaring in his ears. His mind was a bin without end, catching everything.
459.title: Method and apparatus for data storage using ferroelectric random access memory (FRAM) devices
459.abstract: A method of storing data in a non-volatile memory device includes providing a plurality of Ferroelectric Random Access Memory (FeRAM) cells, wherein each FeRAM cell is configured to store at least one bit of data. The method further includes applying a first set of programming pulses to the plurality of FeRAM cells so as to change an electrical polarization state of dielectric layers associated with respective ones of the plurality of FeRAM cells from a first voltage level to a second voltage level different from the first voltage level. The method further includes applying a second set of programming pulses to the plurality of FeRAM cells so as to change the electrical polarization state of the dielectric layers associated with respective ones of the plurality of FeRAM cells from the second voltage level to a third voltage level different from both the first voltage level and the second voltage level.

460.content: Gurney opened eyes bright with moisture, looked down at her. "The Gurney Halleck I knew was a man adept with both blade and baliset," Jessica said. "It was the man of the baliset I most admired.
460.title: Systems and methods for detecting and treating blood-borne pathogens
460.abstract: A system includes a sensor configured to be implanted in a body of a patient, wherein the sensor is configured to emit an electromagnetic signal at a first frequency. The system also includes a controller coupled to the sensor, wherein the controller is configured to receive the electromagnetic signal from the sensor via a wired or wireless connection. The system further includes a rechargeable power source coupled to the controller, wherein the rechargeable power source is configured to provide power to the controller by way of the wired or wireless connection. The system additionally includes a data storage device coupled to the controller, wherein the data storage device is configured to store one or more parameters associated with the emitted electromagnetic signal. Further, the system includes a user interface coupled to the controller, wherein the user interface is configured to display the one or more parameters stored by the data storage device.

461.content: It lifted the 'thopter like a chip on a geyser, spewed them up and out--a winged speck within a core of winding dust lighted by the second moon. Paul looked down, saw the dust-defined pillar of hot wind that had disgorged them, saw the dying storm trailing away like a dry river into the desert--moon-gray motion growing smaller and smaller below as they rode the updraft.
461.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
461.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a current position of the UAV relative to a target location; identifying whether or not the current position of the UAV satisfies a predetermined condition; in response to identification that the current position of the UAV does not satisfy the predetermined condition, adjusting a flight path of the UAV so as to approach the target location; and in response to identification that the current position of the UAV satisfies the predetermined condition, causing the UAV to land at the target location.

462.content: The Duke grabbed the microphone, hesitated with thumb poised over its switch. "How could they lose sight of a carryall?" "They keep their attention on the ground looking for wormsign," Kynes said. The Duke thumbed the switch, spoke into the microphone.

462.abstract: Systems, methods, and computer-readable media are disclosed herein. An example method may include receiving an indication of one or more tasks to be performed by at least one robotic device associated with a first user; determining that the task(s) is/are not executable by the at least one robotic device due to insufficiency of resources provided by the at least one robotic device relative to requirements for execution of the task(s); identifying another robotic device associated with a second user as being capable of performing the task(s), wherein the other robotic device has sufficient resources to perform the task(s); transmitting instructions to the other robotic device instructing the other robotic device to perform the task(s). Other embodiments are disclosed herein.

"Anger is one thing, violence another," the Count said. "Let me caution you: Should an unfortunate accident occur to me here the Great Houses all would learn what you did on Arrakis. They've long suspected how you do business." "The only recent business I can recall," the Baron said, "was transportation of several legions of Sardaukar to Arrakis."
463.title: Sandworms of Dune
463.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for generating sandworms of Dune are provided. The method may include receiving an input to generate a sandworm of Dune; determining one or more characteristics of the sandworm of Dune in accordance with at least one predetermined set of rules associated with the sandworm of Dune; and outputting the generated sandworm of Dune having the determined one or more characteristics. Various other methods, apparatuses, and articles of manufacture are also disclosed herein.

464.content: "Quick! Into the ship. We'll purge this planet of every . . . " Something sparkled to his left. A roll of ball lightning bounced away from the wall there, crackled as it touched the metal floor. The smell of burned insulation swept through the selamlik. "The shield!" one of the Sardaukar officers shouted. "The outer shield is down! They . . . "
464.title: Sandworms of Dune
464.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for generating sandworms of Dune are provided. The method may include receiving an input from a user to generate a sandworm according to one or more parameters associated with the sandworm. The method may further include determining that the generated sandworm is not unique by comparing the generated sandworm to other sandworms stored in a database. In response to determining that the generated sandworm is not unique, the method may include adding the generated sandworm to the database such that the generated sandworm is no longer compared to other sandworms stored in the database.

465.content: He draped the robe over a shoulder, straightening. Now, Paul saw the contents of the mound exposed: the pale glistening gray of a stillsuit, a battered literjon, a kerchief with a small book in its center, the bladeless handle of a crysknife, an empty sheath, a folded pack, a paracompass, a distrans, a thumper, a pile of fist-sized metallic hooks, an assortment of what looked like small rocks within a fold of cloth, a clump of bundled feathers . . . and the baliset exposed beside the folded pack. So Jamis played the baliset, Paul thought. The instrument reminded him of Gurney Halleck and all that was lost.
465.title: Method and apparatus for simulating a musical instrument
465.abstract: A method of simulating a musical instrument is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of obtaining an input signal, wherein the input signal has at least one frequency component; determining whether the at least one frequency component in the input signal exceeds a first predetermined threshold value; if the at least one frequency component in the input signal exceeds the first predetermined threshold value, generating a plurality of harmonics corresponding to the at least one frequency component that exceeds the first predetermined threshold value; and adding the plurality of harmonics to the input signal to generate a synthesized output signal. An apparatus for simulating a musical instrument is also disclosed.

466.content: The hood had been ripped from the cloak, but the man had fashioned a turban from a torn strip of cloth. Wisps of sandy hair protruded from it, matched by a sparse beard and thick brows. Beneath the blue-within-blue eyes, remains of a dark stain spread down to his cheeks. A matted depression across mustache and beard showed where a stillsuit tube had marked out its path from nose to catchpockets. The man stopped half across the dunecrest, arms stretched down the slipface.
466.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) in a hazardous environment
466.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises detecting that the UAV has entered a hazardous environment, wherein the hazardous environment comprises one or more obstacles; determining whether at least one predetermined condition associated with the hazardous environment has been satisfied; when it is determined that the at least one predetermined condition has not been satisfied, causing the UAV to hover above the hazardous environment until the at least one predetermined condition has been satisfied; and when it is determined that the at least one predetermined condition has been satisfied, moving the UAV away from the hazardous environment.

467.content: "One of the cargo men at the entry has all the keys and knows where things should go. Get the keys and the list from him. If there are any questions I'll be in the south wing."
467.title: Apparatus and method for loading and unloading a refrigerated trailer
467.abstract: An apparatus for loading and unloading a refrigerated trailer is disclosed. The apparatus includes a plurality of sensors configured to measure at least one parameter associated with an interior of the refrigerated trailer; a controller in communication with the plurality of sensors, wherein the controller is configured to receive data from the plurality of sensors indicative of measurements of the at least one parameter measured by the plurality of sensors while the refrigerated trailer is being loaded or unloaded; and a display operably coupled to the controller, wherein the display is configured to display information received from the controller relating to the measurements of the at least one parameter as measured by the plurality of sensors when the refrigerated trailer is being loaded or unloaded.

468.title: Sandworms of Dune
468.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for generating sandworms are provided. The method may include receiving an input to generate a sandworm in a virtual reality (VR) environment. The method may further include determining one or more attributes associated with the sandworm using at least one artificial intelligence (AI) technique. The method may also include generating the sandworm having the determined one or more attributes in the VR environment.

469.content: He felt exultant, like an emperor surveying his world. He suppressed a sudden urge to cavort there, to turn the worm, to show off his mastery of this creature. Suddenly he understood why Stilgar had warned him once about brash young men who danced and played with these monsters, doing handstands on their backs, removing both hooks and replanting them before the worm could spill them. Leaving one hook in place, Paul released the other and planted it lower down the side. When the second hook was firm and tested, he brought down the first one, thus worked his way down the side. The maker rolled, and as it rolled, it turned, coming around the sweep of flour sand where the others waited. Paul saw them come up, using their hooks to climb, but avoiding the sensitive ring edges until they were on top. They rode at last in a triple line behind him, steadied against their hooks. Stilgar moved up through the ranks, checked the positioning of Paul's hooks, glanced up at Paul's smiling face.
469.title: Method and apparatus for harvesting seaweed
469.abstract: A method of harvesting seaweed includes providing a plurality of buoys, wherein each one of the plurality of buoys is configured to be submerged in water. Each one of the plurality of buoys comprises at least one inflatable bladder positioned between an upper surface and a lower surface of the respective one of the plurality of buoys. The method also includes arranging the plurality of buoys in a predetermined pattern within a body of water so as to define a pathway through the body of water; and traversing the arranged plurality of buoys along the defined pathway while collecting seaweed that has become entangled with the at least one inflatable bladder associated with each one of the plurality of buoys. An apparatus for harvesting seaweed is also disclosed.

470.content: "If a patrol--" "I will not tell you again, Jamis, to be quiet," Stilgar said. The man above them remained silent, but Jessica heard him moving, crossing by a leap over a defile and working his way down to the basin floor on their left. "The voice of the cielago suggested there'd be value to us in saving you two," Stilgar said. "I can see possibility in this strong boy-man: he is young and can learn. But what of yourself, woman?"
470.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
470.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) includes receiving, by the UAV, at least one sensor measurement from each of a plurality of sensors associated with the UAV. Each of the plurality of sensors is disposed in different locations relative to another of the plurality of sensors. The method also includes determining whether any two of the plurality of sensors are within a predetermined distance of each other. In response to determining that no two of the plurality of sensors are within the predetermined distance of each other, the method further includes generating a flight path for the UAV based on the at least one sensor measurement received from each of the plurality of sensors. However, if it is determined that any two of the plurality of sensors are within the predetermined distance of each other, the method does not include generating

471.content: And he fastened the mask and hood about his face. Gurney obeyed, thankful for the filters. Paul spoke, his voice muffled by the filter: "Which of your crew don't you trust, Gurney?" "There're some new recruits," Gurney said. "Offworlders . . . " He hesitated, wondering at himself suddenly. Offworlders. The word had come so easily to his tongue.
471.title: Airborne pathogen containment apparatus and method
471.abstract: An airborne pathogen containment apparatus includes an enclosure having at least one inlet configured to receive ambient air. A filter is positioned within the enclosure downstream of the at least one inlet, wherein the filter is configured to trap airborne pathogens from the ambient air as the ambient air travels through the enclosure. An ultraviolet germicidal irradiation (UVGI) device is positioned within the enclosure downstream of the filter, wherein the UVGI device is configured to sterilize any airborne pathogens that have not been trapped by the filter.

472.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation/Deep Space Nine crossover fanfiction: The Battle for Qo'noS
472.abstract: A continuation of the Star Trek: The Next Generation storyline in which the Romulans have invaded the Klingon Empire and taken control of their homeworld, Qo'noS.

473.content: -from "The Wisdom of Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan In the stillness of the cavern, Jessica heard the scrape of sand on rock as people moved, the distant bird calls that Stilgar had said were the signals of his watchmen. The great plastic hood-seals had been removed from the cave's opening. She could see the march of evening shadows across the lip of rock in front of her and the open basin beyond. She sensed the daylight leaving them, sensed it in the dry heat as well as the shadows. She knew her trained awareness soon would give her what these Fremen obviously had--the ability to sense even the slightest change in the air's moisture. How they had scurried to tighten their stillsuits when the cave was opened! Deep within the cave, someone began chanting: "Ima trava okolo! I korenja okolo!"
473.title: Water harvesting and recycling methods and apparatuses for use in arid climates
473.abstract: A water harvesting system includes a plurality of tanks, each tank configured to collect rainwater. A pump is coupled to at least one of the tanks such that the pump delivers collected rainwater from an upper tank to a lower tank.

474.title: Systems and methods for treating depression and other mood disorders
474.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure provide systems and methods for treating depression and other mood disorders.

475.content: Stilgar gripped her arm, pointed across the basin. "There! There you see proper Druses." She looked where he pointed, saw movement: people on the basin floor scattering at the daylight into the shadows of the opposite cliffwall.
475.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for determining a plurality
475.abstract: A method includes obtaining an image of a scene comprising one or more objects. The method further includes detecting the one or more objects in the image by processing the image using a trained machine learning model that is configured to classify each object in the image as belonging to at least one of a plurality of predefined classes. The method also includes outputting information characterizing properties of the one or more objects detected in the image. In addition, the method includes providing access to the information characterizing the properties of the one or more objects detected in the image via a graphical user interface (GUI). Further, the method includes receiving input from a user through the GUI indicating a selection of at least one property among the properties of the one or more objects detected in the image. Lastly, the method includes performing an action associated with the selected property(s) of the one or more objects detected in the image.

477.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a perpetrator of a crime
477.abstract: A method is provided for identifying a perpetrator of a crime. 478.content: The Fremen stood up, seated his nose plugs firmly. Hawat motioned with his head for his aide to return to the others. With a tired shrug, the man obeyed. Hawat heard a low-voiced conversation arise among the men. The Fremen said: "There is always a way to water." Behind Hawat, a man cursed. Hawat's aide called: "Thufir!
478.title: Sandworms of Arrakis: war machines of Dune
478.abstract: Implementations are provided for sandworms of Arrakis: war machines of Dune. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method is performed by at least one computing device and includes obtaining data related to the sandworms of Arrakis in Frank Herbert's science fiction novel Dune; extracting features from the obtained data; training an artificial neural network (ANN) model using the extracted features as inputs to train the ANN model with respect to predicting characteristics of the sandworms of Arrakis; receiving user input that specifies a characteristic of the sandworms of Arrakis; feeding the received user input as an input to the trained ANN model; and outputting predictions generated by the trained ANN model regarding the specified characteristic of the sandworms of Arrakis. Other implementations are also provided.

479.content: Other figures stood out in a line trailing away from the ridge. He recognized Chani and Stilgar among them. Stilgar signaled toward the ridge.
479.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for battle of Harkonnen. In some implementations, a method includes presenting, to a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), a first
479.abstract: implementations, a GUI element that is selectable by the user; in response to receiving an indication from the user that the GUI element has been selected, causing one or more additional GUI elements to be presented to the user via the GUI; in response to receiving an indication from the user that at least one of the one or more additional GUI elements has been selected, causing presentation of a second GUI element that is selectable by the user; in response to receiving an indication from the user that the second GUI element has been selected, causing presentation of a third GUI element that is selectable by the user; in response to receiving an indication from the user that the third GUI element has been selected, causing presentation of a fourth GUI element that is selectable by the user; and in response to receiving an indication from the user that the fourth GUI element has been selected, causing presentation of a fifth GUI element that is selectable by the user.
